paras.en: The Spud Lamp was a big hit at the science fair. Jack and I got an A for it. It was the first A Jack got in any class all year long, so he was psyched.
paras.cn: “土豆灯”在科学展览会上一炮而红。我和杰克因此得了个A。这是杰克一整年来在任何课上得到的第一个A，所以他兴奋极了。

vocab.ex: The new song was a big hit on the radio.
She won first prize at the school's science fair for her volcano project.
He was totally psyched about going to the concert.

gram.name: 因果连词 (so)
gram.function: 用于连接原因和结果。'It was the first A Jack got...' 是原因，'so he was psyched' 是这一原因直接导致的结果。

example.en: It started raining, so we went inside.
example.cn: 开始下雨了，所以我们进到了室内。

gram.constraints: 是连接两个独立分句的常用方式。

paras.en: All the science-fair projects were set up on tables in the gym. It was the same setup as the Egyptian Museum back in December, except this time there were volcanoes and molecule dioramas on the tables instead of pyramids and pharaohs. And instead of the kids taking our parents around to look at everybody else's artifact, we had to stand by our tables while all the parents wandered around the room and came over to us one by one.
paras.cn: 所有的科学展览项目都布置在体育馆的桌子上。这和十二月份的埃及博物馆是同样的布置，只不过这次桌子上是火山和分子立体模型，而不是金字塔和法老。而且不是孩子们带我们的父母四处看别人的作品，而是我们必须站在自己的桌子旁，等着所有的父母在房间里闲逛，然后一个接一个地走到我们这里。

vocab.ex: They helped set up the decorations for the party.
For her history project, she made a detailed diorama of a medieval castle.
I'll have tea instead of coffee this morning.

vocab.mean: 手工艺品；（尤指有历史价值的）人工制品
vocab.ex: The museum has a large collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts.
We spent the afternoon just wandering around the old city.

gram.name: 使用 'except' 进行对比
gram.function: 用于先指出两者的相似之处，然后用 'except' 引出关键的不同点，形成清晰的对比。'It was the same setup..., except this time...' 强调了尽管形式相同，但内容已然不同。

example.en: The two cars look identical, except one is blue and the other is red.
example.cn: 这两辆车看起来一模一样，只不过一辆是蓝色的，另一辆是红色的。

gram.constraints: 是一种有效的比较和区分方法。

paras.en: Here's the math on that one: Sixty kids in the grade equals sixty sets of parents—and doesn't even include grandparents. So that's a minimum of one hundred and twenty pairs of eyes that find their way over to me. Eyes that aren't as used to me as their kids' eyes are by now. It's like how compass needles always point north, no matter which way you're facing. All those eyes are compasses, and I'm like the North Pole to them.
paras.cn: 这里面的算术是这样的：年级里六十个孩子等于六十对父母——这还不包括祖父母。所以至少有一百二十双眼睛会找到我这里来。这些眼睛不像他们的孩子的眼睛那样现在已经习惯了我。这就像指南针的指针总是指向北方，无论你朝哪个方向。所有那些眼睛都是指南针，而我对他们来说就像是北极。

vocab.mean: 算术是这样的（用于解释一个计算）
vocab.ex: We need to leave by 8 to arrive at 10. Here's the math on that: the drive is two hours long.
To pass the course, you need a minimum of 70% on the final exam.
The compass needle quivered before finally settling on north.
Santa Claus is said to live at the North Pole.

gram.name: 扩展隐喻
gram.pattern: Developing a single metaphor or analogy at length.
gram.function: 作者建立了一个核心比喻（人们的注视像指南针），然后将其扩展：'All those eyes are compasses, and I'm like the North Pole to them'。这个扩展使得比喻更加完整和有力，生动地传达了主角无论如何都无法逃避众人目光的无力感和宿命感。

example.en: Life is a journey. There are smooth roads and bumpy paths, but the destination is what matters.
example.cn: 人生是一场旅途。有平坦的大道，也有崎岖的小路，但目的地才是最重要的。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的文学技巧，用于构建生动的意象和主题。

paras.en: That's why I still don't like school events that include parents. I don't hate them as much as I did at the beginning of the school year. Like the Thanksgiving Sharing Festival: that was the worst one, I think. That was the first time I had to face the parents all at once. The Egyptian Museum came after that, but that one was okay because I got to dress up as a mummy and nobody noticed me. Then came the winter concert, which I totally hated because I had to sing in the chorus. Not only can I not sing at all, but it felt like I was on display. The New Year Art Show wasn't quite as bad, but it was still annoying.
paras.cn: 这就是为什么我仍然不喜欢有家长参加的学校活动。我不像学年初时那么讨厌它们了。比如感恩节分享节：我想那是最糟糕的一次。那是我第一次必须同时面对所有家长。埃及博物馆在那之后，但那次还行，因为我可以打扮成木乃伊，没人注意到我。然后是冬季音乐会，我完全讨厌那次，因为我得在合唱团里唱歌。我不仅完全不会唱歌，而且感觉就像被展览一样。新年艺术展没那么糟，但仍然很烦人。

vocab.ex: She had to face her fear of public speaking.
Don't try to do everything all at once; focus on one task at a time.
For Halloween, he decided to dress up as a pirate.
The new collection of paintings is on display at the art gallery.
The constant buzzing sound from the fly was very annoying.

gram.name: not only... but (also)... 结构
gram.function: 用于连接两个并列的成分，强调两者兼备，“不仅…而且…”。'Not only can I not sing at all, but it felt like I was on display' 强调了他讨厌音乐会的双重原因。

example.en: Not only is he smart, but he is also very kind.
example.cn: 他不仅聪明，而且还非常善良。

gram.constraints: 当 'Not only' 置于句首时，其后的分句需要部分倒装（助动词或情态动词提前）。

paras.en: They put up our artwork in the hallways all over the school and had the parents come and check it out. It was like starting school all over again, having unsuspecting adults pass me on the stairway. Anyway, it's not that I care that people react to me. Like I've said a gazillion times: I'm used to that by now. I don't let it bother me. It's like when you go outside and it's drizzling a little. You don't put on boots for a drizzle. You don't even open your umbrella. You walk through it and barely notice your hair getting wet.
paras.cn: 他们把我们的艺术作品挂在全校的走廊上，让家长们来参观。那感觉就像重新开学一样，让毫无戒备的成年人在楼梯上经过我。总之，我不是在乎人们对我的反应。就像我说过无数次的那样：我现在已经习惯了。我不让它困扰我。这就像你出门时外面下着毛毛雨。你不会为了一点毛毛雨就穿上靴子。你甚至不打开雨伞。你径直走过去，几乎注意不到头发被打湿。

vocab.ex: They put up posters all over town to advertise the event.

vocab.mean: 毫无戒备的；不起疑心的
vocab.ex: The thief targeted unsuspecting tourists in the crowded square.
I've told you a gazillion times to clean your room!
It started to drizzle, so we decided to head home.
The room was so dark I could barely see anything.

gram.name: 用于轻描淡写的明喻
gram.function: 通过一个常见的、微不足道的场景（淋毛毛雨）来比喻自己对他人反应的习惯性忽视。这个明喻的作用是轻描淡写，表明单个的注视对他来说就像毛毛雨一样，不值得大惊小怪。

example.en: He said learning a new language is like learning to ride a bike; it's hard at first but gets easier.
example.cn: 他说学一门新语言就像学骑自行车；开始很难，但后来会越来越容易。

gram.constraints: 比喻的有效性取决于其与被比喻事物的相似性。

paras.en: But when it's a huge gym full of parents, the drizzle becomes like this total hurricane. Everyone's eyes hit you like a wall of water.
paras.cn: 但当那是一个挤满了家长的巨大体育馆时，毛毛雨就变得像一场彻头彻尾的飓风。所有人的目光像一堵水墙一样向你袭来。

vocab.ex: A light drizzle began to fall.
The city was preparing for the approaching hurricane.
The strong winds hit the coast with great force.

vocab.mean: 一堵…墙（比喻数量巨大且无法穿透）
vocab.ex: The police faced a wall of silence from the witnesses.

gram.name: 对比性隐喻
gram.function: 通过将前一段建立的比喻 'drizzle'（毛毛雨）升级为 'total hurricane'（飓风），作者创造了强烈的对比，生动地展示了从个体反应到群体反应的量变如何引起质变，将微不足道的感觉转变为一种压倒性的、猛烈的冲击。

example.en: A small disagreement at first, their argument soon became a raging fire.
example.cn: 起初只是一个小分歧，他们的争论很快就变成了一场熊熊大火。

gram.constraints: 这是一种扩展并深化比喻的有效技巧。

paras.en: Mom and Dad hang around my table a lot, along with Jack's parents. It's kind of funny how parents actually end up forming the same little groups their kids form. Like my parents and Jack's and Summer's mom all like and get along with each other. And I see Julian's parents hang out with Henry's parents and Miles's parents. And even the two Maxes' parents hang out together. It's so funny.
paras.cn: 爸爸妈妈经常在我桌子旁边逗留，还有杰克的父母。有点好笑的是，父母们最终实际上也组成了和他们孩子一样的小团体。比如我的父母和杰克的父母以及萨默的妈妈都互相喜欢，相处融洽。我看到朱利安的父母和亨利的父母以及迈尔斯的父母一起玩。甚至那两个麦克斯的父母也一起玩。太好笑了。

vocab.ex: A group of teenagers were hanging around the shopping mall.
She went to the party along with her best friend.
He studied to be a doctor but ended up becoming a writer.
It's important to get along with your colleagues.
He likes to hang out with his friends on the weekend.

gram.name: 用于观察的平行结构
gram.pattern: A does X. And B does X. And even C does X.
gram.function: 通过重复相似的句子结构来列举一系列观察到的现象。'my parents and Jack's... get along...', 'Julian's parents hang out with...', 'the two Maxes' parents hang out...' 这一系列平行的句子结构，有力地支撑了“父母们也组成了小团体”这一核心观察。

example.en: The dogs were barking. The cats were meowing. The birds were singing.
example.cn: 狗在叫。猫在喵。鸟在唱。

gram.constraints: 是一种清晰地列举证据或例子的有效方式。

paras.en: I told Mom and Dad about it later when we were walking home, and they thought it was a funny observation. I guess it's true that like seeks like, said Mom.
paras.cn: 后来我们走回家的时候，我把这件事告诉了爸爸妈妈，他们觉得这是一个有趣的观察。“我猜物以类聚，人以群分是真的，” 妈妈说。

vocab.ex: She made an interesting observation about the author's writing style.
It's no surprise they are friends; like seeks like.

gram.name: 用谚语作结论
gram.pattern: Using a proverb to summarize a point.
gram.function: 通过引用一句谚语（'like seeks like'）来为前面段落中具体的观察（父母们形成小团体）提供一个普遍性的、哲学性的总结。这使得具体的个人观察上升到了一个更广泛的社会规律层面。

example.en: He worked hard and finally succeeded. It's true that actions speak louder than words.
example.cn: 他努力工作，最终成功了。“行动胜于雄辩”这句话果然是真的。

gram.constraints: 是一种为具体事件赋予普遍意义的有效修辞手法。

paras.en: For a while, the "war" was all we talked about. February was when it was really at its worst. That's when practically nobody was talking to us, and Julian had started leaving notes in our lockers. The notes to Jack were stupid, like: You stink, big cheese! and Nobody likes you anymore!
paras.cn: 有一段时间，“战争”是我们谈论的全部。二月份是情况最糟糕的时候。那时几乎没人跟我们说话，朱利安开始在我们的储物柜里留纸条。给杰克的纸条很愚蠢，比如：你臭死了，大奶酪！还有：再也没人喜欢你了！

vocab.ex: He lived in another city for a while before moving back home.
The storm was at its worst around midnight.
The room was so crowded that we were practically sitting on top of each other.
He thinks that new movie stinks.

gram.name: 强调句型 (That's when...)
gram.function: 用于强调某个事件发生的时间点。'That's when practically nobody was talking to us' 强调了“没人跟我们说话”这件事正是发生在二月份这个最糟糕的时期。

example.en: We were having a great time at the beach. That's when it started to rain.
example.cn: 我们正在海滩上玩得很开心。就在那时，天开始下雨了。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的叙事技巧，用于突出特定时刻。

paras.en: I got notes like: Freak! And another that said: Get out of our school, orc! Summer thought we should report the notes to Ms. Rubin, who was the middle-school dean, or even Mr. Tushman, but we thought that would be like snitching. Anyway, it's not like we didn't leave notes, too, though ours weren't really mean. They were kind of funny and sarcastic.
paras.cn: 我收到的纸条写着：怪物！还有一张说：滚出我们的学校，兽人！萨默认为我们应该把这些纸条报告给初中部主任鲁宾女士，甚至是塔什曼先生，但我们觉得那就像告密。总之，也不是说我们没留纸条，不过我们的纸条并没什么恶意。它们有点好笑和讽刺。

vocab.ex: He was called a freak at school just because he had different interests.
In the story, the heroes had to fight an army of orcs.

vocab.mean: （大学的）学院院长；（中学的）训导主任
vocab.ex: The student was sent to the dean's office for misbehaving.
He didn't want to snitch on his friends, so he kept quiet.
That was a mean thing to say to your sister.
He has a very sarcastic sense of humor that some people don't understand.

gram.name: It's not like... (用于反驳或澄清)
gram.function: 用于引出一个事实，以反驳或澄清一个潜在的误解。'it's not like we didn't leave notes, too' 意思是“也不是说我们就没留纸条”，用于承认己方也有行动，但随后用 'though' 引出区别，表明己方行为并无恶意。

example.en: You should study more! - It's not like I haven't been trying!
example.cn: 你应该多学习！- 又不是说我没在努力！

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的非正式辩解或澄清的说法。

paras.en: One was: You're so pretty, Julian! I love you. Will you marry me? Love, Beulah Another was: Love your hair! XOX Beulah Another was: You're a babe. Tickle my feet. XO Beulah. Beulah was a made-up person that me and Jack came up with. She had really gross habits, like eating the green stuff in between her toes and sucking on her knuckles. And we figured someone like that would have a real crush on Julian, who looked and acted like someone in a KidzBop commercial.
paras.cn: 一张是：你真漂亮，朱利安！我爱你。你愿意嫁给我吗？爱你的，比尤拉。另一张是：爱你的头发！亲亲抱抱 比尤拉。还有一张是：你是个宝贝。挠我脚心。亲亲抱抱 比尤拉。比尤拉是我和杰克虚构出来的人。她有一些非常恶心的习惯，比如吃脚趾缝里的绿东西和吮吸自己的指关节。我们琢磨着，像那样的人会对朱利安有真正的迷恋，因为朱利安看起来和表现得就像KidzBop广告里的人一样。

vocab.ex: He called her 'babe' as a term of endearment.
The child told a made-up story about a talking dragon.
She came up with a great idea for the project.
There was a dead spider on the wall, it was so gross.
He cracked his knuckles, a habit that annoyed his sister.
She had a huge crush on the lead singer of the band.

gram.name: 并置（用于反讽）
gram.pattern: Placing two contrasting ideas or images side-by-side.
gram.function: 通过将一个极度“恶心”的角色（Beulah）与一个极度“完美”的角色（Julian, 'like someone in a KidzBop commercial'）并置，并声称前者迷恋后者，作者创造出一种强烈的反讽和幽默效果。这种不协调的搭配是对Julian的一种嘲弄。

example.en: He described the billionaire's lavish party, then immediately mentioned the starving children outside the gates.
example.cn: 他描述了亿万富翁的奢华派对，然后立刻提到了门外饥饿的儿童。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比来产生意义的修辞手法。

paras.en: There were also a couple of times in February when Julian, Miles, and Henry played tricks on Jack. They didn't play tricks on me, I think, because they knew that if they got caught "bullying" me, it would be big-time trouble for them. Jack, they figured, was an easier target. So one time they stole his gym shorts and played Monkey in the Middle with them in the locker room. Another time Miles, who sat next to Jack in homeroom, swiped Jack's worksheet off his desk, crumpled it in a ball, and tossed it to Julian across the room. This wouldn't have happened if Ms. Petosa had been there, of course, but there was a substitute teacher that day, and subs never really know what's going on.
paras.cn: 二月份也有几次，朱利安、迈尔斯和亨利对杰克搞恶作剧。我想，他们没对我搞恶作剧，是因为他们知道如果被抓到“欺负”我，他们会有大麻烦。他们琢磨着，杰克是个更容易下手的目标。所以有一次他们在更衣室偷了他的运动短裤，拿来玩“中间的猴子”游戏。另一次，在班级教室坐在杰克旁边的迈尔斯，把杰克的练习纸从他桌上抢走，揉成一团，扔给了房间另一头的朱利安。当然，如果佩托萨女士在场，这种事是不会发生的，但那天有个代课老师，而代课老师们从来都搞不清状况。

vocab.ex: My little brother loves to play tricks on me, like hiding my shoes.
If you break that rule, you will be in big-time trouble.
He swiped a cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
He crumpled the letter and threw it in the trash.
Could you toss me that apple, please?
When our regular teacher was sick, we had a substitute teacher for the day.

gram.name: 第三条件句
gram.pattern: wouldn't have + past participle + if + past perfect
gram.function: 用于描述与过去事实相反的假设情况及其可能的结果。'This wouldn't have happened if Ms. Petosa had been there' 描述了一个未发生的过去情况（佩托萨女士当时不在场）及其假设的结果。

example.en: I wouldn't have been late if the bus had been on time.
example.cn: 如果公交车准时的话，我就不会迟到了。

gram.constraints: 用于对过去情况的虚拟假设。

paras.en: Jack was good about this stuff. He never let them see he was upset, though I think sometimes he was. The other kids in the grade knew about the war. Except for Savanna's group, the girls were neutral at first. But by March they were getting sick of it. And so were some of the boys. Like another time when Julian was dumping some pencilsharpener shavings into Jack's backpack, Amos, who was usually tight with them, grabbed the backpack out of Julian's hands and returned it to Jack. It was starting to feel like the majority of boys weren't buying into Julian anymore.
paras.cn: 杰克对这些事处理得很好。他从不让他们看到他很沮丧，尽管我想他有时是沮丧的。年级里的其他孩子都知道这场战争。除了萨凡纳的那个小团体，女孩们起初是中立的。但到了三月份，她们开始对此感到厌烦了。一些男孩也是如此。比如另一次，当朱利安把一些卷笔刀屑倒进杰克的背包时，通常和他们关系很铁的阿莫斯，从朱利安手里抢过背包还给了杰克。感觉好像大多数男孩都不再吃朱利安那一套了。

vocab.ex: She's very good about remembering people's birthdays.
He was upset when he lost the game.
Switzerland is known for being a neutral country.
I'm sick of eating the same thing for lunch every day.
There were wood shavings all over the floor of the workshop.
He's been tight with his best friend since kindergarten.
I don't buy into his excuses for being late.

gram.name: so 引起的倒装
gram.function: 用于表示“……也是如此”，以避免重复前文的谓语部分。'And so were some of the boys' 等于 'And some of the boys were getting sick of it, too'。

example.en: She was tired, and so was I.
example.cn: 她累了，我也一样。

gram.constraints: 助动词或be动词的形式需与主语和前文时态保持一致。

paras.en: Then a few weeks ago, Julian started spreading this ridiculous rumor that Jack had hired some "hit man" to "get" him and Miles and Henry. This lie was so pathetic that people were actually laughing about him behind his back. At that point, any boys who had still been on his side now jumped ship and were clearly neutral. So by the end of March, only Miles and Henry were on Julian's side—and I think even they were getting tired of the war by then.
paras.cn: 然后几周前，朱利安开始散布一个荒谬的谣言，说杰克雇了某个“杀手”来“对付”他、迈尔斯和亨利。这个谎言太可悲了，以至于人们实际上都在背后嘲笑他。到那时，任何之前还站在他那边的男孩现在都倒戈了，并且明确表示中立。所以到三月底，只有迈尔斯和亨利还站在朱利安一边——而且我想，到那时就连他们也对这场战争感到厌倦了。

vocab.ex: He was wearing a ridiculous hat that made everyone laugh.
Don't believe every rumor you hear.
The movie was about a retired hit man trying to live a normal life.
His attempt to lie was so pathetic that nobody believed him.
When the company started losing money, several key employees jumped ship.

gram.name: At that point (时间标记)
gram.function: 用于在叙事中标记一个特定的时间点，引出在该时间点发生或改变的情况，意为“到那时”。它有助于清晰地组织事件的时间顺序。

example.en: We had been arguing for hours. At that point, I realized we would never agree.
example.cn: 我们已经争论了好几个小时。到那时，我意识到我们永远不会达成一致。

gram.constraints: 通常放在句首，后面跟逗号。

paras.en: I'm pretty sure everyone's stopped playing the Plague game behind my back, too. No one really cringes if I bump into them anymore, and people borrow my pencils without acting like the pencil has cooties.
paras.cn: 我也很确定大家已经不再背着我玩“瘟疫”游戏了。如果我不小心碰到他们，再也没人真的会畏缩了，而且人们借我的铅笔时也不会表现得好像铅笔上有虱子一样。

vocab.ex: I'm pretty sure I locked the door before I left.
The Black Death was a devastating plague in the 14th century.
I always cringe when I hear that song.
Be careful not to bump into the table and spill the drinks.

vocab.mean: （儿童用语）虱子；（想象中的）细菌
vocab.ex: The little kids ran away from the girl, shouting that she had cooties.

gram.name: act like + 从句
gram.function: 用于描述某人的行为像是在某种情境下一样，进行比喻。'...acting like the pencil has cooties' 生动地描绘了孩子们过去那种嫌弃的态度。

example.en: Stop acting like you own the place!
example.cn: 别表现得好像这个地方是你的一样！

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的描述行为的比喻方式。

paras.en: People even joke around with me now sometimes. Like the other day I saw Maya writing a note to Ellie on a piece of Uglydoll stationery, and I don't know why, but I just kind of randomly said: "Did you know the guy who created the Uglydolls based them on me?" Maya looked at me with her eyes wide open like she totally believed me. Then, when she realized I was only kidding, she thought it was the funniest thing in the world. "You are so funny, August!" she said, and then she told Ellie and some of the other girls what I had just said, and they all thought it was funny, too. Like at first they were shocked, but then when they saw I was laughing about it, they knew it was okay to laugh about it, too. And the next day I found a little Uglydoll key chain sitting on my chair with a nice little note from Maya that said: For the nicest Auggie Doll in the world! XO Maya.
paras.cn: 人们现在有时甚至会和我开玩笑了。比如前几天我看到玛雅在一张丑娃娃信纸上给艾莉写纸条，我不知道为什么，但我就是有点随机地说：“你知道创造丑娃娃的那个人是根据我来设计它们的吗？” 玛雅睁大眼睛看着我，好像她完全相信了我似的。然后，当她意识到我只是在开玩笑时，她觉得这是世界上最好笑的事情。“你太有趣了，奥古斯特！” 她说，然后她把刚才我说的话告诉了艾莉和其他一些女孩，她们也都觉得很好笑。比如一开始她们很震惊，但当她们看到我也在笑时，她们就知道对此发笑也是可以的。第二天，我发现我的椅子上放着一个小小的丑娃娃钥匙链，还有一张玛雅写的友好的小纸条，上面说：给世界上最好的奥吉娃娃！亲亲抱抱 玛雅。

vocab.ex: He loves to joke around with his friends after school.
She wrote the letter on her personal stationery.
He randomly picked a book from the shelf to read.
The movie is based on a true story.
He had a small souvenir key chain from his trip.

gram.name: 因果关系（社交暗示）
gram.pattern: When A happens, B knows it's okay to do C.
gram.function: 描述了一种社交学习过程。'when they saw I was laughing about it, they knew it was okay to laugh about it, too' 清晰地展示了其他人是如何通过观察主角的自我解嘲行为，来判断什么是可以接受的社交互动，从而打破了围绕他外貌的禁忌。

example.en: When he saw his parents clapping, the little boy knew it was okay to take a bow.
example.cn: 当他看到父母在鼓掌时，小男孩就知道可以鞠躬了。

gram.constraints: 是描述社交互动和界限建立的有效结构。

paras.en: Six months ago stuff like that would never have happened, but now it happens more and more. Also, people have been really nice about the hearing aids I started wearing.
paras.cn: 六个月前，像那样的事情是绝对不会发生的，但现在它越来越频繁地发生了。而且，大家对我开始戴的助听器也一直非常友好。

vocab.ex: A few years ago, a success like this would never have happened.
It's getting more and more difficult to find affordable housing in the city.
My grandfather wears a hearing aid in his left ear.

gram.name: would (用于过去的假设)
gram.function: 用于描述在过去某个时间点下，某个事件是不可能发生的，与第三条件句的主句功能相似，但条件从句是隐含的。'Six months ago stuff like that would never have happened' 隐含的条件是“（如果时间回到）六个月前”，以此来强调今昔的巨大变化。

example.en: In the old days, a computer like this would have seemed like science fiction.
example.cn: 在过去，像这样的一台电脑会像是科幻小说里的东西。

gram.constraints: 用于对过去情况的虚拟对比。

paras.en: Ever since I was little, the doctors told my parents that someday I'd need hearing aids. I don't know why this always freaked me out a bit: maybe because anything to do with my ears bothers me a lot. My hearing was getting worse, but I hadn't told anyone about it. The ocean sound that was always in my head had been getting louder. It was drowning out people's voices, like I was underwater. I couldn't hear teachers if I sat in the back of the class. But I knew if I told Mom or Dad about it, I'd end up with hearing aids—and I was hoping I could make it through the fifth grade without having that happen.
paras.cn: 从小时候起，医生就告诉我父母，总有一天我需要助听器。我不知道为什么这总让我有点害怕：也许是因为任何与我耳朵有关的事情都让我很烦恼。我的听力一直在变差，但我没有告诉任何人。我脑中一直有的那种海洋般的声音变得越来越响。它淹没了人们的声音，就像我在水下一样。如果我坐在教室后面，我就听不清老师说话。但我知道如果我告诉爸爸妈妈，我最终就会戴上助听器——而我一直希望能撑过五年级，不要发生那种事。

vocab.ex: My grandfather wears a hearing aid in his left ear.

vocab.mean: 使（某人）极度不安或害怕
vocab.ex: Spiders really freak me out.
His job has something to do with computers.
The sound of the airplane overhead drowned out our conversation.
If you don't study, you'll end up with a bad grade.
It was a difficult week, but we all managed to make it through.

gram.name: 过去进行时（用于描述逐渐变化）
gram.function: 用于描述在过去一段时间内正在发生的、持续的或逐渐变化的过程。'My hearing was getting worse' 和 'It was drowning out people's voices' 描述了听力问题在过去一段时间里的恶化过程。

example.en: As the sun set, the sky was getting darker.
example.cn: 随着太阳下山，天空正变得越来越暗。

gram.constraints: 强调过程的持续性。

paras.en: But then in my annual checkup in October I flunked the audiology test and the doctor was like, "Dude, it's time." And he sent me to a special ear doctor who took impressions of my ears.
paras.cn: 但后来在十月份的年度体检中，我的听力测试不及格，医生就说：“老兄，是时候了。” 然后他把我送到了一个专门的耳朵医生那里，他给我的耳朵取了模。

vocab.ex: It's important to have an annual checkup to monitor your health.
If you don't study, you're going to flunk the exam.
The audiology report showed significant hearing loss.
The dentist took an impression of my teeth to make a new crown.

gram.name: be like (用于引述)
gram.function: 在非正式的口语叙事中，'be like' 是一种非常常见的用法，用来引述某人说过的话。它比 'said' 更具对话感和即时性，生动地再现了当时的场景。

example.en: I asked him for help, and he was like, 'No way!'
example.cn: 我向他求助，他当时就说：‘门儿都没有！’

gram.constraints: 主要用于非正式口语和模仿口语的写作中。

paras.en: Out of all my features, my ears are the ones I hate the most. They're like tiny closed fists on the sides of my face. They're too low on my head, too. They look like squashed pieces of pizza dough sticking out of the top of my neck or something. Okay, maybe I'm exaggerating a little. But I really hate them.
paras.cn: 在我所有的五官中，我的耳朵是我最讨厌的。它们就像我脸两侧小小的紧握的拳头。它们在我头上长的位置也太低了。它们看起来像被压扁的披萨面团，从我脖子顶上伸出来什么的。好吧，也许我有点夸张了。但我真的讨厌它们。

vocab.ex: She has very delicate facial features.
He clenched his fist in anger.
I found a squashed spider on the bottom of my shoe.
He kneaded the pizza dough until it was smooth and elastic.
He tends to exaggerate his stories to make them more interesting.

gram.name: 使用 'like' 的明喻
gram.function: 用于将一事物与另一事物进行直接比较，以创造生动、具体的形象。作者连续使用了两个比喻（'like tiny closed fists' 和 'like squashed pieces of pizza dough'）来描绘他耳朵的奇特外形，传达了他的自我厌恶感。

example.en: His angry face looked like a thundercloud.
example.cn: 他愤怒的脸看起来像一团雷雨云。

gram.constraints: 'Like' 用于非正式比较。

paras.en: When the ear doctor first pulled the hearing aids out for me and Mom to look at, I groaned. "I am not wearing that thing," I announced, folding my arms in front of me.
paras.cn: 当耳朵医生第一次拿出助听器给我和妈妈看时，我呻吟了一声。“我才不戴那玩意儿，” 我宣告道，双臂交叉在胸前。

vocab.ex: He pulled out his wallet to pay for the coffee.
The injured player groaned in pain.
The company will announce its quarterly earnings next week.

vocab.mean: 双臂交叉于胸前（常表示抗拒或不悦）
vocab.ex: She folded her arms and refused to listen.

gram.name: 现在分词作伴随状语
gram.function: 用于描述与主句动作同时发生的伴随动作。'I announced, folding my arms...' 描述了“宣告”和“双臂交叉”这两个动作是同时进行的，后者在身体语言上强化了前者的抗拒态度。

example.en: "I don't believe you," she said, shaking her head.
example.cn: “我不相信你，” 她说着，摇了摇头。

gram.constraints: 分词的逻辑主语必须是主句的主语。

paras.en: "I know they probably look kind of big," said the ear doctor, "but we had to attach them to the headband because we had no other way of making them so they'd stay in your ears." See, normal hearing aids usually have a part that wraps around the outer ear to hold the inner bud in place. But in my case, since I don't have outer ears, they had to put the earbuds on this heavy-duty headband that was supposed to wrap around the back of my head.
paras.cn: “我知道它们可能看起来有点大，” 耳朵医生说，“但我们必须把它们固定在头带上，因为我们没有别的方法能让它们待在你的耳朵里。” 你看，普通的助听器通常有一个环绕外耳的部分，用来固定内部的耳塞。但在我的情况下，因为我没有外耳，他们不得不把耳塞放在这个应该绕在我后脑勺的重型头带上。

vocab.ex: Please attach this label to your luggage.
She wore a colorful headband to keep her hair out of her face.
The snake wrapped itself around the tree branch.
He used glue to hold the broken pieces in place.
Most people enjoy parties, but in my case, I prefer quiet evenings at home.
You'll need a heavy-duty rope for that kind of climbing.

gram.name: 话语标记 (See, ...)
gram.function: 在句首使用 'See,' 是一种非正式的、对话式的方式，用于引出一段解释或澄清，意为“你看，”或“是这样的，” 。它邀请读者进入叙述者的视角，理解他所要解释的情况。

example.en: I can't come tonight. See, I have to study for a big exam.
example.cn: 我今晚来不了。是这样的，我得为一个大考复习。

gram.constraints: 常用于口语和非正式写作中。

paras.en: "I can't wear that, Mom," I whined. "You'll hardly notice them," said Mom, trying to be cheerful. "They look like headphones." "Headphones? Look at them, Mom!" I said angrily. "I'll look like Lobot!"
paras.cn: “我不能戴那个，妈妈，” 我抱怨道。“你几乎不会注意到它们的，” 妈妈试着表现得高兴地说。“它们看起来像耳机。” “耳机？你看看它们，妈妈！” 我生气地说。“我会看起来像洛博特的！”

vocab.ex: The child started to whine when he didn't get the toy he wanted.
It was so foggy I could hardly see the road.
She has a very cheerful personality and is always smiling.
He was listening to music on his new headphones.
The Star Wars character Lobot has a distinctive cybernetic device on his head.

gram.name: look like (用于比较)
gram.function: 用于描述外貌上的相似性。对话中出现了两次对比：妈妈试图用积极的 'headphones' 来比喻，而主角则用他认为负面的 'Lobot' 来反驳，突显了两人视角的冲突。

example.en: That cloud looks like a dragon.
example.cn: 那朵云看起来像一条龙。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的描述性语言。

paras.en: "Which one is Lobot?" said Mom calmly. "Lobot?" The ear doctor smiled as he looked at the headphones and made some adjustments. " The Empire Strikes Back? The bald guy with the cool bionic radiotransmitter thing that wraps around the back of his skull?" "I'm drawing a blank," said Mom. "You know Star Wars stuff?" I asked the ear doctor. "Know Star Wars stuff?" he answered, slipping the thing over my head. "I practically invented Star Wars stuff!"
paras.cn: “哪个是洛博特？” 妈妈平静地问。“洛博特？” 耳朵医生笑了，一边看着那个头戴设备一边做些调整。“是《帝国反击战》里的？那个光头，后脑勺上绕着很酷的生化无线电发射器的家伙？” “我想不起来了，” 妈妈说。“你知道《星球大战》的东西？” 我问耳朵医生。“知道《星球大战》的东西？” 他回答，一边把那东西套到我头上。“我简直是发明了《星球大战》的东西！”

vocab.ex: Despite the chaos around him, he spoke calmly and clearly.
The superhero had a bionic arm with incredible strength.
The museum had a collection of ancient animal skulls.
I'm sorry, I'm drawing a blank on his name right now.
The room was so crowded that we were practically sitting on top of each other.

gram.name: 回声问句（用于互动）
gram.pattern: Repeating a question back to the asker.
gram.function: 通过重复对方的问题（'Know Star Wars stuff?'），说话者不仅确认了问题，还以此为引子，引出自己夸张而幽默的回答。这是一种建立融洽关系、展示个性和幽默感的有效对话技巧。

example.en: A: Are you a fan of jazz music? B: Am I a fan of jazz music? I live and breathe it!
example.cn: A：你是爵士乐迷吗？B：我算不算爵士乐迷？我简直为它而生！

gram.constraints: 是一种非正式的、充满表现力的对话方式。

paras.en: "Now, Auggie, I want to explain what all this is," he said, pointing to the different parts of one of the hearing aids. "This curved piece of plastic over here connects to the tubing on the ear mold. That's why we took those impressions back in December, so that this part that goes inside your ear fits nice and snug. This part here is called the tone hook, okay? And this thing is the special part we've attached to this cradle here."
paras.cn: “好了，奥吉，我想解释一下所有这些都是什么，” 他说，指着其中一个助听器的不同部分。“这边这个弯曲的塑料片连接着耳模上的导管。这就是为什么我们十二月份取了那些印模，这样这个进入你耳朵的部分就能贴合得又好又紧。这里这个部分叫做声钩，好吗？而这个东西是我们固定在这个支架上的特殊部分。”

vocab.ex: The road had a sharp, curved section.
The plumber needed to replace a piece of copper tubing.
A custom ear mold ensures the hearing aid fits perfectly.
The new shoes were a snug fit.
He placed his phone in the charging cradle on his desk.

gram.name: That's why... (表原因)
gram.function: 用于引出一个结果，并解释其原因。'That's why we took those impressions...' 解释了“取印模”这个过去行为的目的，即为了让助听器能“贴合得又好又紧”。

example.en: He missed the bus. That's why he was late for work.
example.cn: 他错过了公交车。那就是他上班迟到的原因。

gram.constraints: 是一种清晰地连接因果关系的常用结构。

paras.en: "The Lobot part," I said miserably. "Hey, Lobot is cool," said the ear doctor. "It's not like we're saying you're going to look like Jar Jar, you know? That would be bad." He slid the earphones on my head again carefully. "There you go, August. So how's that?"
paras.cn: “洛博特那部分，” 我痛苦地说。“嘿，洛博特很酷，” 耳朵医生说。“也不是说你会看起来像加·加·宾克斯，你知道吧？那才糟糕呢。” 他小心地又把耳机套到我头上。“好了，奥古斯特。感觉怎么样？”

vocab.ex: "I failed the test," he said miserably.

vocab.mean: 加·加·宾克斯（星球大战角色）
vocab.ex: The character Jar Jar Binks is often considered one of the most annoying in the Star Wars series.
She quickly slid on her shoes and ran out the door.
"There you go," said the hairdresser after finishing the haircut.

gram.name: It's not like... (用于安慰/反驳)
gram.function: 用于引出一个事实来反驳或减轻对方的担忧。'It's not like we're saying you're going to look like Jar Jar' 意思是“我们又没说你会像加·加那样”，通过提出一个更糟糕的可能性（像一个普遍不受欢迎的角色）来反衬“像Lobot”其实没那么糟，这是一种幽默的安慰方式。

example.en: Don't worry about being a few minutes late. It's not like the world is going to end.
example.cn: 别担心迟到几分钟。又不是世界末日。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的非正式说法。

paras.en: "Totally uncomfortable!" I said. "You'll get used to them very quickly," he said. I looked in the mirror. My eyes started tearing up. All I saw were these tubes jutting out from either side of my head— like antennas. "Do I really have to wear this, Mom?" I said, trying not to cry. "I hate them. They don't make any difference!"
paras.cn: “完全不舒服！” 我说。“你会很快习惯它们的，” 他说。我看了看镜子。我的眼睛开始涌出泪水。我所能看到的只是这些管子从我头的两侧伸出来——像天线一样。“我真的必须戴这个吗，妈妈？” 我说，努力不哭出来。“我讨厌它们。它们根本没什么用！”

vocab.ex: These new shoes are very uncomfortable.
It takes time to get used to living in a new city.
Her eyes started to tear up during the sad movie.
A rocky ledge jutted out from the cliff face.
The old television had two long antennas on top.
Volunteering in your community can really make a difference.

gram.name: 强调句型 (All I saw... was/were...)
gram.function: 用于强调“唯一”的概念，即某人所能看到的唯一事物。'All I saw were these tubes...' 强调了在那个瞬间，他唯一注意到的就是那些管子，突显了他对自己外貌变化的强烈负面感受。

example.en: I looked at the menu for ten minutes, but all I saw was pizza.
example.cn: 我看了十分钟菜单，但我眼里只有披萨。

gram.constraints: 后面的 'that' 常常被省略。

paras.en: "Give it a second, buddy," said the doctor. "I haven't even turned them on yet. Wait until you hear the difference: you'll want to wear them." "No I won't!" And then he turned them on.
paras.cn: “给它一点时间，伙计，” 医生说。“我还没打开它们呢。等到你听到区别：你就会想戴了。” “我才不会！” 然后他打开了它们。

vocab.ex: The computer is slow to start; just give it a second.
Hey buddy, can you help me with this?
Please turn on the lights; it's getting dark.

gram.name: 用于高潮的简短陈述句
gram.function: 在一系列对话和情感铺垫之后，使用一个极简短、客观的陈述句 'And then he turned them on.' 来作为章节的结尾，创造了一种强烈的戏剧性高潮和悬念。它将所有的冲突和期待都集中在这个即将揭晓结果的动作上。

example.en: She stood at the edge of the diving board, took a deep breath, and looked down. And then she jumped.
example.cn: 她站在跳板的边缘，深吸一口气，向下看去。然后她跳了下去。

gram.constraints: 其力量来自于其简洁性和在叙事中的位置。

paras.en: How can I describe what I heard when the doctor turned on my hearing aids? Or what I didn't hear? It's too hard to think of words. The ocean just wasn't living inside my head anymore. It was gone. I could hear sounds like shiny lights in my brain. It was like when you're in a room where one of the lightbulbs on the ceiling isn't working, but you don't realize how dark it is until someone changes the lightbulb and then you're like, whoa, it's so bright in here! I don't know if there's a word that means the same as "bright" in terms of hearing, but I wish I knew one, because my ears were hearing brightly now.
paras.cn: 我该如何描述当医生打开我的助听器时我听到了什么？或者说，我没听到了什么？太难想出词语来形容了。那片海洋不再住在我的脑海里了。它消失了。我能听到的声音就像我大脑里闪亮的光芒。这就像你在一个房间里，天花板上的一个灯泡坏了，但你并没意识到有多暗，直到有人换了灯泡，然后你就会感叹：哇，这里真亮！我不知道有没有一个词在听觉上和“明亮”是同一个意思，但我希望我知道一个，因为我的耳朵现在听得非常明亮。

vocab.ex: Please turn on the lights; it's getting dark.
The old lightbulb flickered and then went out.
Whoa, that's the biggest dog I've ever seen!
In terms of flavor, this coffee is the best I've had.
The sun was shining brightly in the clear blue sky.

gram.name: 通感与扩展明喻
gram.pattern: Describing one sense using terms from another.
gram.function: 作者使用了通感（Synesthesia）的修辞手法，用视觉词汇（'shiny lights', 'bright'）来描述听觉体验，创造出一种新颖而强烈的感官感受。随后，他将这个比喻扩展为一个完整的场景（换灯泡），让读者能够更具体、更深刻地理解这种从“暗”到“明”的巨大转变。

example.en: Her voice was like smooth velvet.
example.cn: 她的声音如同光滑的天鹅绒。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的文学技巧，用于创造独特、多维度的感官体验。

paras.en: "How does it sound, Auggie?" said the ear doctor. "Can you hear me okay, buddy?" I looked at him and smiled but I didn't answer. "Sweetie, do you hear anything different?" said Mom. "You don't have to shout, Mom." I nodded happily. "Are you hearing better?" asked the ear doctor. "I don't hear that noise anymore," I answered. "It's so quiet in my ears."
paras.cn: “听起来怎么样，奥吉？” 耳朵医生说。“你能听清我说话吗，伙计？” 我看着他笑了笑，但没有回答。“宝贝，你听到什么不一样了吗？” 妈妈说。“你不用喊，妈妈。” 我开心地点了点头。“你听得更清楚了吗？” 耳朵医生问。“我再也听不到那个噪音了，” 我回答。“我的耳朵里好安静。”

vocab.ex: Hey buddy, can you help me with this?
Come here, sweetie, and give me a hug.
You don't need to shout; I can hear you perfectly well.

gram.name: 通过对话进行暗示
gram.pattern: A character's response reveals a change.
gram.function: 作者没有直接说“妈妈的声音太大了”，而是通过主角的回答 'You don't have to shout, Mom' 来巧妙地揭示听力改善的程度。这种“展示而非告知”（Show, don't tell）的技巧，让读者通过角色的互动自己得出结论，比直接陈述更生动。

example.en: A: "Is it cold outside?" B: "I can see my breath."
example.cn: A：“外面冷吗？” B：“我能看到自己呼出的哈气。”

gram.constraints: 是一种有效的叙事技巧，使故事更具互动性。

paras.en: "The white noise is gone," he said, nodding. He looked at me and winked. "I told you you'd like what you heard, August." He made more adjustments on the left hearing aid. "Does it sound very different, love?" Mom asked. "Yeah." I nodded. "It sounds . . . lighter."
paras.cn: “白噪音消失了，” 他点着头说。他看着我，眨了眨眼。“我告诉过你你会喜欢你听到的，奥古斯特。” 他在左边的助听器上做了更多调整。“听起来很不一样吗，亲爱的？” 妈妈问。“是的。” 我点了点头。“听起来……更轻了。”

vocab.ex: Some people use a white noise machine to help them sleep.
He winked at me to show that he was only joking.
The mechanic made a few adjustments to the engine.
This box is much lighter than the other one.

gram.name: 省略号（用于思考性停顿）
gram.function: 用于表示说话者在说话过程中的停顿，通常是因为在思考或寻找合适的词语。'"It sounds . . . lighter."' 中的省略号，生动地表现了主角在努力寻找词汇来描述一种全新的、难以言喻的感官体验。

example.en: I think it's... interesting.
example.cn: 我觉得它……很有趣。

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中表现人物内心活动的有效标点。

paras.en: "That's because you have bionic hearing now, buddy," said the ear doctor, adjusting the right side. "Now touch here." He put my hand behind the hearing aid. "Do you feel that? That's the volume. You have to find the volume that works for you. We're going to do that next. Well, what do you think?" He picked up a small mirror and had me look in the big mirror at how the hearing aids looked in the back. My hair covered most of the headband. The only part that peeked out was the tubing.
paras.cn: “那是因为你现在有了仿生听力，伙计，” 耳朵医生说，一边调整右边。“现在摸这里。” 他把我的手放在助听器后面。“你感觉到了吗？那是音量。你得找到适合你的音量。我们接下来就做这个。嗯，你觉得怎么样？” 他拿起一面小镜子，让我在大镜子里看助听器在后面看起来怎么样。我的头发遮住了大部分头带。唯一露出来的部分是导管。

vocab.ex: The superhero had a bionic arm with incredible strength.
The photographer was adjusting the lens of his camera.
Could you turn down the volume of the music, please?
The sun peeked out from behind the clouds.
The plumber needed to replace a piece of copper tubing.

gram.name: 使役动词 (have sb do sth)
gram.function: 表示“让/使某人做某事”，通常用于给出指令或安排。'...had me look in the big mirror...' 意思是“让我看大镜子”。

example.en: The teacher had us write a short essay.
example.cn: 老师让我们写了一篇短文。

gram.constraints: 在主动语态中，have, make, let 后面跟不带 to 的不定式作宾补。

paras.en: "Are you okay with your new bionic Lobot hearing aids?" the ear doctor asked, looking in the mirror at me. "Yeah," I said. "Thank you." "Thank you so much, Dr. James," said Mom.
paras.cn: “你对你的新仿生洛博特助听器还满意吗？” 耳朵医生看着镜子里的我问道。“嗯，” 我说。“谢谢你。” “非常感谢您，詹姆斯医生，” 妈妈说。

vocab.ex: Are you okay with having pizza for dinner tonight?
The Star Wars character Lobot has a distinctive cybernetic device on his head.

gram.name: 使用文化引用建立联系
gram.function: 医生通过再次引用主角之前提到的《星球大战》角色 'Lobot'，将一个可能令人尴尬的医疗设备与一个“酷”的角色联系起来。这种策略不仅显示了他的同理心和幽默感，还有助于将主角的负面感受转化为一种更积极的、基于共同兴趣的体验。

example.en: He compared his difficult task to climbing Mount Doom, a reference his friend immediately understood.
example.cn: 他把自己艰巨的任务比作攀登末日火山，他的朋友立刻就懂了这个梗。

gram.constraints: 其有效性取决于对方是否理解该引用。

paras.en: The first day I showed up at school with the hearing aids, I thought kids would make a big deal about it. But no one did. Summer was glad I could hear better, and Jack said it made me look like an FBI agent or something. But that was it. Mr. Browne asked me about it in English class, but it wasn't like, what the heck is that thing on your head?! It was more like, "If you ever need me to repeat something, Auggie, make sure you tell me, okay?"
paras.cn: 我第一天戴着助听器去学校时，我以为孩子们会对此大惊小怪。但谁也没有。萨默为我能听得更清楚感到高兴，杰克说那让我看起来像个FBI特工什么的。但仅此而已。布朗先生在英语课上问了我这件事，但不是那种“你头上那是什么鬼东西？！”的方式。他更像是说：“如果你需要我重复什么，奥吉，一定要告诉我，好吗？”

vocab.ex: He didn't show up at the party until very late.
It was just a small mistake; don't make a big deal about it.
In the movie, he plays an FBI agent investigating a crime.
What the heck is that noise outside?

gram.name: It wasn't like... It was more like... (对比结构)
gram.pattern: It wasn't like [negative example], it was more like [positive example].
gram.function: 用于对比和澄清。作者首先否定了一种可能的、负面的情景（'what the heck...'），然后给出了真实的、积极的情景（'If you ever need me...'）。这种结构有力地突出了老师处理方式的体贴和善意。

example.en: Our conversation wasn't like an argument; it was more like a healthy debate.
example.cn: 我们的谈话不像是一场争吵，更像是一场健康的辩论。

gram.constraints: 是一种有效的澄清和对比方法。

paras.en: Now that I look back, I don't know why I was so stressed about it all this time. Funny how sometimes you worry a lot about something and it turns out to be nothing.
paras.cn: 现在回想起来，我不知道为什么我一直以来都对此那么紧张。真有意思，有时候你为一件事担心得要命，结果却什么事也没有。

vocab.ex: Now that the exams are over, we can finally relax.
When I look back on my childhood, I have many happy memories.
She was very stressed about her upcoming job interview.

vocab.mean: 结果什么事也没有；原来是虚惊一场
vocab.ex: I thought I heard a strange noise, but it turned out to be nothing.

gram.name: 格言式陈述 (Funny how...)
gram.function: 用于引出一个具有讽刺意味或出人意料的普遍性观察。'Funny how...' 开头的句子通常带有哲理或感悟的意味，将个人的具体经历提炼成一个更广泛的人生道理。

example.en: It's funny how you can live in a city for years and still discover new places.
example.cn: 真有意思，你可以在一个城市住上好几年，却仍然能发现新的地方。

gram.constraints: 是一种非正式的、表达感悟的方式。

paras.en: A couple of days after spring break ended, Mom found out that Via hadn't told her about a school play that was happening at her high school the next week. And Mom was mad. Mom doesn't really get mad that much (though Dad would disagree with that), but she was really mad at Via for that. She and Via got into a huge fight. I could hear them yelling at each other in Via's room. My bionic Lobot ears could hear Mom saying: "But what is with you lately, Via? You're moody and taciturn and secretive. . . ."
paras.cn: 春假结束几天后，妈妈发现维娅没有告诉她下周她高中有一场学校戏剧。妈妈生气了。妈妈不常那么生气（尽管爸爸会不同意这一点），但她这次真的为那事生维娅的气了。她和维娅大吵了一架。我能听到她们在维娅的房间里互相大喊。我那仿生的洛博特耳朵能听到妈妈说：“但是你最近到底怎么了，维娅？你喜怒无常、沉默寡言、还神神秘秘的……”

vocab.ex: Many college students go to the beach during spring break.
I need to find out what time the train leaves.
He tends to get mad over very small things.
The two brothers got into a fight over a video game.
I haven't seen him much lately.
He's been very moody and difficult to talk to this week.
The new student was taciturn and didn't say much in class.

vocab.mean: 神神秘秘的；守口如瓶的
vocab.ex: She's been very secretive about her plans for the weekend.

gram.name: What is with you? (用于询问行为)
gram.function: 一种非正式的、带有困惑或不满情绪的提问方式，用于询问某人反常或奇怪行为的原因，意为“你到底怎么了？”

example.en: You've been so quiet all day. What is with you?
example.cn: 你一整天都那么安静。你到底怎么了？

gram.constraints: 通常用于非正式对话中，语气可以从关心到恼怒不等。

paras.en: "What is so wrong with my not telling you about a stupid play?" Via practically screamed. "I don't even have a speaking part in it!" "Your boyfriend does! Don't you want us to see him in it?" "No! Actually, I don't!" "Stop screaming!" "You screamed first! Just leave me alone, okay? You've been really good about leaving me alone my whole life, so why you choose high school to suddenly be interested I have no idea. . . ." Then I don't know what Mom answered because it all got very quiet, and even my bionic Lobot ears couldn't pick up a signal.
paras.cn: “我不告诉你一场愚蠢的戏剧有什么大不了的？” 维娅几乎是尖叫着说。“我在里面甚至没有台词！” “你男朋友有！你不想让我们看他演吗？” “不！实际上，我不想！” “别叫了！” “是你先叫的！别管我，好吗？你这辈子在不管我这方面一直做得很好，所以我真搞不懂你为什么偏偏选择高中时突然对我感兴趣……” 接着我就不知道妈妈回答了什么，因为一切都变得非常安静，就连我那仿生的洛博特耳朵也接收不到信号了。

vocab.ex: The room was so crowded that we were practically sitting on top of each other.
It was a small role, but she was excited to have her first speaking part.
Please just leave me alone for a little while; I need to think.
I have no idea why he quit his job so suddenly.
My phone can't pick up a signal in this remote area.

gram.name: 反问式抱怨 (Why... I have no idea)
gram.function: 这是一种带有强烈讽刺和抱怨意味的结构。说话者将一个本应是问句的 'why...' 从句作为 'I have no idea' 的主语，形式上是在陈述自己“不知道”，但实际上是在强烈地质问和指责对方行为的不合逻辑。这是一种非常情绪化的表达方式。

example.en: Why he thinks that's a good idea, I have no idea.
example.cn: 我真搞不懂他为什么会认为那是个好主意。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的、口语化的表达方式，用于表达强烈的困惑和不满。

paras.en: By dinner they seemed to have made up. Dad was working late. Daisy was sleeping. She'd thrown up a lot earlier in the day, and Mom made an appointment to take her to the vet the next morning. The three of us were sitting down and no one was talking.
paras.cn: 到晚饭时，她们似乎已经和好了。爸爸工作到很晚。黛西在睡觉。她白天早些时候吐了很多，妈妈约了第二天早上带她去看兽医。我们三个人坐着，谁也没说话。

vocab.ex: After their argument, the two friends quickly made up.
He ate some bad food and had to throw up.
I need to make an appointment to see the dentist.
If your pet is sick, you should take it to the vet.

gram.name: 用简单陈述句设置场景
gram.pattern: A series of short, factual sentences.
gram.function: 通过一连串简短、客观的陈述句（'Dad was working late. Daisy was sleeping. ...no one was talking.'），作者营造了一种安静、凝滞甚至有些紧张的家庭氛围，为后面即将爆发的冲突做了铺垫。

example.en: The sun set. The birds stopped singing. A cold wind began to blow.
example.cn: 太阳落山了。鸟儿停止了歌唱。一阵冷风开始吹来。

gram.constraints: 这种技巧通过省略复杂的连接词，让读者自己感受场景中的情绪。

paras.en: Finally, I said: "So, are we going to see Justin in a play?" Via didn't answer but looked down at her plate. "You know, Auggie," said Mom quietly. "I hadn't realized what play it was, and it really isn't something that would be interesting to kids your age." "So I'm not invited?" I said, looking at Via. "I didn't say that," said Mom. "It's just I don't think it's something you'd enjoy." "You'd get totally bored," said Via, like she was accusing me of something.
paras.cn: 最后，我说：“那么，我们要去看贾斯汀演戏吗？” 维娅没有回答，而是低头看着她的盘子。“你知道，奥吉，” 妈妈轻声说。“我之前没意识到是什么戏，而且那真的不是你这个年纪的孩子会感兴趣的东西。” “所以没邀请我？” 我看着维娅说。“我没那么说，” 妈妈说。“只是我觉得你不会喜欢。” “你会觉得超级无聊的，” 维娅说，听起来像是在指责我什么。

vocab.ex: He finished all the food on his plate.
He didn't realize his mistake until it was too late.
Are you invited to his birthday party?
I really enjoy reading historical novels.
She accused him of stealing her wallet.

gram.name: 委婉语与回避
gram.pattern: Using indirect language to avoid a difficult topic.
gram.function: 妈妈和维娅没有直接说出不想让奥吉去的原因，而是使用了一些借口，如“你不会感兴趣的”或“你会觉得无聊”。这种委婉和回避的做法，虽然意图可能是保护，但却引发了主角的怀疑和后续的冲突。

example.en: Instead of saying he was fired, they said his position was 'eliminated.'
example.cn: 他们没有说他被解雇了，而是说他的职位被“取消”了。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的社交策略，但有时会引起误解。

paras.en: "Are you and Dad going?" I asked. "Dad'll go," said Mom. "I'll stay home with you." "What?" Via yelled at Mom. "Oh great, so you're going to punish me for being honest by not going?" "You didn't want us to go in the first place, remember?" answered Mom. "But now that you know about it, of course I want you to go!" said Via. "Well, I've got to weigh everyone's feelings here, Via," said Mom.
paras.cn: “你和爸爸去吗？” 我问。“爸爸会去，” 妈妈说。“我会留下来陪你。” “什么？” 维娅对妈妈喊道。“哦太好了，所以你打算用不去看戏来惩罚我的诚实吗？” “你一开始就不想我们去，记得吗？” 妈妈回答。“但现在你们知道了，我当然想让你们去！” 维娅说。“嗯，我得在这里权衡每个人的感受，维娅，” 妈妈说。

vocab.ex: The teacher had to punish the student for cheating.
I should never have gone there in the first place.
You must weigh the pros and cons before making a decision.

gram.name: 指责性问句
gram.function: 维娅的问题 'so you're going to punish me...?' 并非真的在寻求信息，而是一种带有强烈指责和讽刺意味的修辞手法。她用这个问题来表达她对妈妈决定（不去）的愤怒和不满。

example.en: "Are you going to ignore me all day just because I was five minutes late?"
example.cn: “你难道就因为我迟到了五分钟，就要一整天都不理我吗？”

gram.constraints: 是一种在争吵中常见的情感表达方式。

paras.en: "What are you two talking about?" I shouted. "Nothing!" they both snapped at the same time. "Just something about Via's school that has nothing to do with you," said Mom. "You're lying," I said. "Excuse me?" said Mom, kind of shocked. Even Via looked surprised. "I said you're lying!" I shouted. "You're lying!" I screamed at Via, getting up. "You're both liars! You're both lying to my face like I'm an idiot!"
paras.cn: “你们俩在说什么？” 我喊道。“没什么！” 她们俩同时厉声说。“只是关于维娅学校的一些事，跟你没关系，” 妈妈说。“你在撒谎，” 我说。“你说什么？” 妈妈说，有点震惊。连维娅看起来也很惊讶。“我说你在撒谎！” 我喊道。“你在撒谎！” 我对维娅尖叫，站了起来。“你们都是骗子！你们俩都在当着我的面撒谎，好像我是个白痴一样！”

vocab.ex: You don't need to shout; I can hear you perfectly well.
"Leave me alone!" he snapped.
His personal life has nothing to do with his ability to do the job.
He's a known liar, so don't believe anything he says.
If you have a problem with me, say it to my face, not behind my back.

gram.name: 重复（用于指责）
gram.function: 通过反复、逐步升级地重复指责（'You're lying... I said you're lying!... You're lying!... You're both liars!'），作者生动地展现了主角情绪的爆发过程，从怀疑到愤怒再到彻底的爆发。这种重复极大地增强了戏剧张力和情感强度。

example.en: "You broke it!" she said. "I know you did! You broke it!"
example.cn: “你弄坏了！” 她说。“我知道是你干的！你弄坏了！”

gram.constraints: 是一种在冲突场景中常见的、表现强烈情感的技巧。

paras.en: "Sit down, Auggie!" said Mom, grabbing my arm. I pulled my arm away and pointed at Via. "You think I don't know what's going on?" I yelled. "You just don't want your brand-new fancy high school friends to know your brother's a freak!" "Auggie!" Mom yelled. "That's not true!" "Stop lying to me, Mom!" I shrieked. "Stop treating me like a baby! I'm not retarded! I know what's going on!"
paras.cn: “坐下，奥吉！” 妈妈说，抓住了我的胳膊。我甩开胳膊，指着维娅。“你以为我不知道是怎么回事吗？” 我吼道。“你只是不想让你那些全新的、时髦的高中朋友知道你弟弟是个怪物！” “奥吉！” 妈妈喊道。“那不是真的！” “别再对我撒谎了，妈妈！” 我尖叫道。“别再把我当小孩子对待了！我不是弱智！我知道是怎么回事！”

vocab.ex: She had to grab her hat to stop it from blowing away.
He bought a brand-new car.
They went to a fancy restaurant for their anniversary.
He was called a freak at school just because he had different interests.
She shrieked when she saw the spider.
This word is now considered offensive and is not used in modern respectful language.

gram.name: 并列祈使句 (Stop...)
gram.function: 通过连续使用 'Stop...' 结构的祈使句，主角表达了他对妈妈行为的强烈抗议和要求。'Stop lying...' 和 'Stop treating me...' 是两个并列的、核心的诉求，显示了他的愤怒和渴望被平等对待的心情。

example.en: Stop shouting at me! Stop telling me what to do!
example.cn: 别对我大喊大叫！别再告诉我该做什么！

gram.constraints: 是一种在争吵中常见的、表达强烈要求的句型。

paras.en: I ran down the hallway to my room and slammed the door behind me so hard that I actually heard little pieces of the wall crumble inside the door frame. Then I plopped onto my bed and pulled the covers up on top of me. I threw my pillows over my disgusting face and then piled all my stuffed animals on top of the pillows, like I was inside a little cave. If I could walk around with a pillow over my face all the time, I would.
paras.cn: 我跑下走廊回到我的房间，把门在我身后重重地关上，用力之大，我居然听到了门框里墙壁的小碎块剥落的声音。然后我“扑通”一声倒在床上，把被子拉上来盖住自己。我把枕头扔在我恶心的脸上，然后把所有毛绒玩具都堆在枕头上，就像我在一个小洞穴里一样。如果我能一直顶着枕头走路，我会的。

vocab.ex: He got angry and slammed the door as he left.
The old castle walls are starting to crumble.
After a long day, she plopped onto the couch.
He piled the books neatly on the table.
Her bed was covered with stuffed animals.
The explorers found ancient paintings inside the cave.

gram.name: 第二条件句（用于表达愿望）
gram.function: 用于描述与现在或将来事实相反的、不可能的假设情况及其可能的结果，常用来表达强烈的愿望。'If I could walk around with a pillow over my face..., I would' 表达了主角想要永久躲藏起来的强烈愿望。

example.en: If I could fly, I would travel the world.
example.cn: 如果我会飞，我就会环游世界。

gram.constraints: 条件从句用一般过去时，主句用 'would/could/might + 动词原形'。

paras.en: I don't even know how I got so mad. I wasn't really mad at the beginning of dinner. I wasn't even sad. But then all of a sudden it all kind of just exploded out of me. I knew Via didn't want me to go to her stupid play. And I knew why.
paras.cn: 我甚至不知道自己怎么会那么生气。晚饭刚开始时我并没真的生气。我甚至不难过。但后来突然之间，所有的情绪就那样从我身体里爆发出来了。我知道维娅不想让我去她那愚蠢的戏剧。我也知道为什么。

vocab.ex: Please be quiet at the beginning of the movie.
We were walking in the park when all of a sudden it started to rain.
After weeks of stress, his anger finally exploded out of him.

gram.name: 简短结论性句子
gram.function: 在一系列描述情绪爆发的句子之后，使用两个非常简短、肯定的陈述句 'I knew Via didn't want me to go...' 和 'And I knew why'，可以创造出一种强烈的顿悟感和结论性。它们简洁有力地总结了主角情绪爆发的根本原因。

example.en: He looked at the clues again. He saw the pattern. He knew the answer.
example.cn: 他又看了一遍线索。他看出了模式。他知道了答案。

gram.constraints: 其力量来自于其简洁性和在叙事中的位置。

paras.en: I figured Mom would follow me into my room right away, but she didn't. I wanted her to find me inside my cave of stuffed animals, so I waited a little more, but even after ten minutes she still didn't come in after me. I was pretty surprised. She always checks on me when I'm in my room, upset about stuff. I pictured Mom and Via talking about me in the kitchen. I figured Via was feeling really, really, really bad. I pictured Mom totally laying on the guilt. And Dad would be mad at her when he came home, too.
paras.cn: 我琢磨着妈妈会立刻跟着我进我房间，但她没有。我想让她在我毛绒玩具的洞穴里找到我，所以我又等了一会儿，但即使十分钟后她仍然没有跟进来。我相当惊讶。当我因为什么事在房间里不开心时，她总是会来看我。我想象着妈妈和维娅在厨房里谈论我。我琢磨着维娅感觉一定非常、非常、非常糟糕。我想象着妈妈在使劲让她内疚。而爸爸回家后也会生她的气。

vocab.ex: I figure it's going to rain later, so I'll bring an umbrella.
When the fire alarm rang, we left the building right away.
Could you check on the baby to make sure she's still sleeping?
I can't picture him as a father.
She's good at laying on the guilt to get what she wants.

gram.name: 重复以示强调
gram.function: 通过重复副词 'really' ('really, really, really bad') 来极大地加强情感的强度，模仿了儿童说话时天真而夸张的语气，生动地传达了主角想象中维娅“极其糟糕”的感觉。

example.en: I am so, so, so tired of this.
example.cn: 我真是太、太、太烦这个了。

gram.constraints: 这是一种非常口语化和非正式的强调方式。

paras.en: I made a little hole through the pile of pillows and stuffed animals and peeked at the clock on my wall. Half an hour had passed and Mom still hadn't come into my room. I tried to listen for the sounds in the other rooms. Were they still having dinner? What was going on? Finally, the door opened. It was Via. She didn't even bother coming over to my bed, and she didn't come in softly like I thought she would. She came in quickly.
paras.cn: 我在枕头和毛绒玩具堆里弄了个小洞，偷偷看我墙上的时钟。半个小时过去了，妈妈还没进我房间。我试着听听其他房间的声音。她们还在吃晚饭吗？到底怎么了？终于，门开了。是维娅。她甚至都没费事走到我床边，而且她也不是像我想象的那样轻手轻脚地进来。她很快地走了进来。

vocab.ex: There was a large pile of dirty clothes on the floor.
The child peeked at the presents under the Christmas tree.
I was listening for the sound of the doorbell.
Don't bother making dinner; we can order a pizza.
She closed the door softly so as not to wake the baby.

gram.name: 用问题营造悬念
gram.pattern: A series of short questions showing internal thought.
gram.function: 通过主角内心的一系列简短问题（'Were they still having dinner? What was going on?'），作者生动地展现了他的不安、困惑和期待，有效地营造了悬念，让读者和主角一起等待接下来会发生什么。

example.en: The phone rang in the middle of the night. Who could it be? Was something wrong?
example.cn: 半夜电话响了。会是谁呢？是出什么事了吗？

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的叙事技巧，用于揭示角色的内心世界和推动情节。

paras.en: "Auggie," said Via. "Come quick. Mom needs to talk to you." "I'm not apologizing!" "This isn't about you!" she yelled. "Not everything in the world is about you, Auggie! Now hurry up. Daisy's sick. Mom's taking her to the emergency vet. Come say goodbye."
paras.cn: “奥吉，” 维娅说。“快来。妈妈要跟你说话。” “我才不道歉！” “这事跟你没关系！” 她喊道。“世界上不是所有事都围着你转的，奥吉！现在快点。黛西病了。妈妈要带她去看急诊兽医。快来跟她说再见。”

vocab.ex: You should apologize for being so rude.

vocab.mean: 是关于你的事；围着你转
vocab.ex: Stop making this all about you; other people have problems too.
Hurry up, or we'll be late for the movie!
Our cat was very sick, so we rushed it to the emergency vet.

gram.name: 焦点转移与紧急性
gram.pattern: Using sharp, direct statements to change the topic.
gram.function: 通过一系列简短、直接且充满情感的句子（'This isn't about you!', 'Now hurry up.', 'Daisy's sick.'），维娅迅速地将对话的焦点从前一章的家庭内部矛盾转移到一个全新的、更紧急的危机上，营造了强烈的紧迫感。

example.en: Stop arguing about dinner! The house is on fire!
example.cn: 别再为晚饭争吵了！房子着火了！

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中创造戏剧性转折的有效技巧。

paras.en: I pushed the pillows off my face and looked up at her. That's when I saw she was crying. "What do you mean 'goodbye'?" "Come on!" she said, holding out her hand. I took her hand and followed her down the hall to the kitchen. Daisy was lying down sideways on the floor with her legs straight out in front of her. She was panting a lot, like she'd been running in the park. Mom was kneeling beside her, stroking the top of her head. "What happened?" I asked.
paras.cn: 我把枕头从脸上推开，抬头看着她。就在那时，我看到她在哭。“你说的‘再见’是什么意思？” “快来！” 她说，伸出手。我牵起她的手，跟着她走下走廊来到厨房。黛西侧躺在地板上，腿直直地伸在前面。她大口地喘着气，就像刚在公园里跑完步一样。妈妈跪在她旁边，抚摸着她的头顶。“发生什么事了？” 我问。

vocab.ex: The crab walked sideways across the sand.
After running up the stairs, he was panting heavily.
It's polite to kneel when you speak to a small child.
She gently stroked the cat's soft fur.

gram.name: 强调句型 (That's when...)
gram.function: 用于强调某个事件发生或被意识到的确切时间点。'That's when I saw she was crying' 强调了主角意识到事态严重性的关键时刻。

example.en: We were about to leave. That's when the phone rang.
example.cn: 我们正要离开。就在那时，电话响了。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的叙事技巧，用于突出特定时刻。

paras.en: "She just started whimpering all of a sudden," said Via, kneeling down next to Mom. I looked down at Mom, who was crying, too. "I'm taking her to the animal hospital downtown," she said. "The taxi's coming to pick me up." "The vet'll make her better, right?" I said. Mom looked at me. "I hope so, honey," she said quietly. "But I honestly don't know." "Of course he will!" I said. "Daisy's been sick a lot lately, Auggie. And she's old . . ." "But they can fix her," I said, looking at Via to agree with me, but Via wouldn't look up at me.
paras.cn: “她刚才突然开始呜咽，” 维娅跪在妈妈旁边说。我低头看着妈妈，她也在哭。“我要带她去市区的动物医院，” 她说。“出租车要来接我了。” “兽医会治好她的，对吧？” 我说。妈妈看着我。“我希望如此，宝贝，” 她轻声说。“但我真的不知道。” “他当然会！” 我说。“黛西最近病得很厉害，奥吉。而且她老了……” “但他们能治好她，” 我说，看着维娅希望她能同意我，但维娅没有抬头看我。

vocab.ex: The lost puppy started to whimper for its mother.
Let's go downtown for dinner tonight.
Honestly, I don't think that's a good idea.
The mechanic needs to fix the brakes on my car.

gram.name: 视角对比（否认 vs 现实）
gram.function: 通过主角充满希望和确定性的陈述（'Of course he will!', 'they can fix her'）与妈妈充满不确定性和悲伤现实的回答（'I honestly don't know', 'she's old...'）的鲜明对比，作者深刻地描绘了儿童面对悲剧时的否认心理和成年人的无奈现实。

example.en: Child: "He'll come back, I know it!" Parent: "Sweetheart, we have to be realistic."
example.cn: 孩子：“他会回来的，我知道！” 家长：“宝贝，我们必须面对现实。”

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中揭示角色不同认知和情感状态的有效技巧。

paras.en: Mom's lips were trembling. "I think it might be time we say goodbye to Daisy, Auggie. I'm sorry." "No!" I said. "We don't want her to suffer, Auggie," she said. The phone rang. Via picked it up, said, "Okay, thanks," and then hung up. "The taxi's outside," she said, wiping her tears with the backs of her hands.
paras.cn: 妈妈的嘴唇在颤抖。“我想也许是时候我们跟黛西说再见了，奥吉。对不起。” “不！” 我说。“我们不想让她受苦，奥吉，” 她说。电话响了。维娅接起电话，说了句“好的，谢谢”，然后挂了电话。“出租车在外面了，” 她说，用手背擦着眼泪。

vocab.ex: His hands started to tremble with fear.
It's getting late; it might be time to go home.
He didn't want to see his old dog suffer anymore.
She got angry and hung up the phone.

gram.name: It's time 后的虚拟语气
gram.pattern: It is time + Subject + past simple
gram.function: 用于表示“是时候做某事了”，暗示这件事早该做或现在必须做了。后面从句中的动词使用一般过去时（'we say goodbye' 中的 'say' 是不带 's' 的原形，符合此处的虚拟用法，但更常见的是 'said'），表示虚拟语气。

example.en: It's time you went to bed.
example.cn: 你该上床睡觉了。

variants: It is time + for someone + to-infinitive
gram.constraints: 从句中的动词用过去时，但表示的是对现在或未来的建议或要求。

paras.en: "Okay, Auggie, open the door for me, sweetie?" said Mom, picking Daisy up very gently like she was a huge droopy baby. "Please, no, Mommy?" I cried, putting myself in front of the door. "Honey, please," said Mom. "She's very heavy." "What about Daddy?" I cried. "He's meeting me at the hospital," Mom said. "He doesn't want Daisy to suffer, Auggie."
paras.cn: “好的，奥吉，给妈妈开门好吗，宝贝？” 妈妈说，非常温柔地把黛西抱起来，好像她是一个巨大的、耷拉着的婴儿。“求你了，不要，妈咪？” 我哭着说，把自己挡在门前。“宝贝，求你了，” 妈妈说。“她很重。” “那爸爸呢？” 我哭着问。“他在医院等我，” 妈妈说。“他不想让黛西受苦，奥吉。”

vocab.ex: He closed the door gently so as not to wake the baby.
The plant's leaves were droopy from lack of water.
The child started to cry when he fell down.
He didn't want to see his old dog suffer anymore.

gram.name: 恳求性对话
gram.pattern: Using words like 'please' and questioning intonation.
gram.function: 通过使用 'please' 和将陈述句变为问句的形式（'Please, no, Mommy?'），作者生动地传达了主角绝望的恳求。这种 childlike（孩子气的）表达方式，比直接说 'Please don't go' 更具情感冲击力。

example.en: "Can I have one more story, please?" the child pleaded.
example.cn: “能再给我讲一个故事吗，求你了？” 孩子恳求道。

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中表现强烈情感和脆弱的方式。

paras.en: Via moved me away from the door and held it open it for Mom. "My cell phone's on if you need anything," Mom said to Via. "Can you cover her with the blanket?" Via nodded, but she was crying hysterically now. "Say goodbye to Daisy, kids," Mom said, tears streaming down her face. "I love you, Daisy," Via said, kissing Daisy on the nose. "I love you so much." "Bye, little girlie . . . ," I whispered into Daisy's ear. "I love you. . . ."
paras.cn: 维娅把我从门口挪开，为妈妈扶着门。“如果你们需要什么，我的手机开着，” 妈妈对维娅说。“你能用毯子把她盖上吗？” 维娅点了点头，但她现在已经哭得歇斯底里了。“跟黛西说再见吧，孩子们，” 妈妈说，泪水顺着她的脸流下来。“我爱你，黛西，” 维娅说，亲吻着黛西的鼻子。“我非常爱你。” “再见，小姑娘……” 我在黛西耳边低语。“我爱你……”

vocab.ex: He held the door open for the woman carrying heavy bags.
Don't forget to charge your cell phone before you leave.
She was laughing hysterically at his joke.
Tears were streaming down his face as he watched the sad movie.

gram.name: 情感背景下的直接指令
gram.function: 在极度悲伤和紧急的情境中，使用简短、直接的祈使句（'Say goodbye to Daisy, kids'）可以传达出一种无法回避的、沉重的现实。它不是一个请求，而是一个温柔但坚决的指令，标志着一个不可逆转的时刻的到来。

example.en: The doctor looked at the family and said sadly, "Brace yourselves."
example.cn: 医生看着那家人，悲伤地说：“做好心理准备吧。”

gram.constraints: 其情感力量来自于上下文。

paras.en: Mom carried Daisy down the stoop. The taxi driver had opened the back door and we watched her get in. Just before she closed the door, Mom looked up at us standing by the entrance to the building and she gave us a little wave. I don't think I've ever seen her look sadder. "I love you, Mommy!" said Via. "I love you, Mommy!" I said. "I'm sorry, Mommy!" Mom blew a kiss to us and closed the door. We watched the car leave and then Via closed the door. She looked at me a second, and then she hugged me very, very tight while we both cried a million tears.
paras.cn: 妈妈抱着黛西走下门廊的台阶。出租车司机已经打开了后门，我们看着她上车。就在她关上门之前，妈妈抬头看着站在大楼入口的我们，给了我们一个小小的挥手。我想我从未见过她看起来更悲伤的样子。“我爱你，妈咪！” 维娅说。“我爱你，妈咪！” 我说。“对不起，妈咪！” 妈妈给了我们一个飞吻，然后关上了门。我们看着车子离开，然后维娅关上了门。她看了我一秒钟，然后紧紧地、紧紧地抱住我，我们俩都流下了一百万滴眼泪。

vocab.ex: The neighbors were sitting on their stoop, chatting in the evening sun.
I've never seen a sadder movie in my life.
The little girl blew a kiss to her grandmother before getting on the school bus.
She hugged her son tight before he left for college.
She cried a million tears when her beloved pet passed away.

gram.name: 夸张法（用于表达悲痛）
gram.pattern: An exaggerated statement for emotional effect.
gram.function: 通过使用极度夸张的说法（'we both cried a million tears'），作者生动地传达了孩子们无法估量的、压倒性的悲伤。这并非字面上的事实，而是一种强烈的情感表达，让读者能感受到他们悲痛的深度。

example.en: My heart broke into a million pieces when I heard the news.
example.cn: 当我听到那个消息时，我的心碎成了一百万片。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的情感表达修辞手法。

paras.en: Justin came over about half an hour later. He gave me a big hug and said: "Sorry, Auggie." We all sat down in the living room, not saying anything. For some reason, Via and I had taken all of Daisy's toys from around the house and had put them in a little pile on the coffee table. Now we just stared at the pile.
paras.cn: 大约半小时后，贾斯汀过来了。他给了我一个大大的拥抱，说：“对不起，奥吉。” 我们都坐在客厅里，谁也没说话。不知什么原因，我和维娅把黛西在屋子里的所有玩具都拿了出来，在咖啡桌上堆成了一小堆。现在我们只是盯着那一堆东西看。

vocab.ex: Why don't you come over for dinner tonight?

vocab.mean: 不知何故；不知什么原因
vocab.ex: For some reason, the key isn't working in the lock today.
There was a large pile of dirty clothes on the floor.
It's rude to stare at people.

gram.name: 过去完成时（用于背景动作）
gram.function: 表示在过去某个时间点或动作之前已经完成的动作。'Via and I had taken... and had put...' 描述了在“我们坐下盯着看”这个主要场景开始之前，收集玩具的动作已经完成，为场景提供了背景。

example.en: By the time I arrived, he had already left.
example.cn: 我到的时候，他已经离开了。

gram.constraints: 通常用于区分两个过去动作的先后顺序。

paras.en: "She really is the greatest dog in the world," said Via. "I know," said Justin, rubbing Via's back. "She just started whimpering, like all of a sudden?" I said. Via nodded. "Like two seconds after you left the table," she said. "Mom was going to go after you, but Daisy just started, like, whimpering." "Like how?" I said. "Just whimpering, I don't know," said Via. "Like howling?" I asked.
paras.cn: “她真是世界上最棒的狗，” 维娅说。“我知道，” 贾斯汀说，抚摸着维娅的背。“她就是突然开始呜咽的吗？” 我说。维娅点了点头。“就像你离开桌子两秒钟后，” 她说。“妈妈正要去找你，但黛西就开始，呃，呜咽了。” “怎么样的？” 我说。“就是呜咽，我不知道，” 维娅说。“像嚎叫那样？” 我问。

vocab.ex: He was rubbing his tired eyes.
The lost puppy started to whimper for its mother.
We were walking in the park when all of a sudden it started to rain.
We could hear a wolf howling in the distance.

gram.name: 话语标记 'like'
gram.function: 在非正式口语中，'like' 常被用作填充词，表示说话者的犹豫、思考，或用来软化语气。维娅在描述创伤性事件时使用 'like' ('Daisy just started, like, whimpering')，真实地反映了她在努力回忆和表达时的情绪。

example.en: I was, like, so surprised I didn't know what to say.
example.cn: 我当时，呃，太惊讶了，都不知道该说什么。

gram.constraints: 是口语的自然组成部分，但在正式写作中应避免。

paras.en: "Auggie, like whimpering!" she answered impatiently. "She just started moaning, like something was really hurting her. And she was panting like crazy. Then she just kind of plopped down, and Mom went over and tried to pick her up, and whatever, she was obviously hurting. She bit Mom." "What?" I said. "When Mom tried to touch her stomach, Daisy bit her hand," Via explained. "Daisy never bites anybody!" I answered. "She wasn't herself," said Justin. "She was obviously in pain."
paras.cn: “奥吉，就是呜咽！” 她不耐烦地回答。“她就是开始呻吟，好像有什么东西真的很疼。而且她疯狂地喘气。然后她就那样扑通一声倒下了，妈妈走过去想把她抱起来，然后不管怎样，她显然很疼。她咬了妈妈。” “什么？” 我说。“当妈妈想摸她肚子的时候，黛西咬了她的手，” 维娅解释道。“黛西从来不咬人！” 我回答。“她当时不正常了，” 贾斯汀说。“她显然很痛苦。”

vocab.ex: She tapped her foot impatiently while waiting in line.
The sick patient started to moan softly.
After the race, the runner was panting like crazy.
He plopped down on the sofa, exhausted from work.
He's wearing a coat, so obviously it's cold outside.
She's been very quiet all day; she just isn't herself.
After the accident, he was clearly in a lot of pain.

gram.name: 一般现在时（用于普遍真理）
gram.function: 用于描述一个普遍的事实或习惯性行为。'Daisy never bites anybody!' 使用一般现在时来强调“不咬人”是黛西一贯的、不变的性格特征，以此来反衬她这次行为的极度反常。

example.en: The sun rises in the east.
example.cn: 太阳从东方升起。

gram.constraints: 用于描述规律或不变的事实。

paras.en: "Daddy was right," said Via. "We shouldn't have let her get this bad." "What do you mean?" I said. "He knew she was sick?" "Auggie, Mom's taken her to the vet like three times in the last two months. She's been throwing up left and right. Haven't you noticed?" "But I didn't know she was sick!" Via didn't say anything, but she put her arm around my shoulders and pulled me closer to her. I started to cry again.
paras.cn: “爸爸是对的，” 维娅说。“我们本不该让她病得这么重的。” “你什么意思？” 我说。“他知道她病了吗？” “奥吉，过去两个月妈妈带她去看了三次兽医。她一直吐个没完。你没注意到吗？” “但我不知道她病了！” 维娅什么也没说，但她用胳膊搂住我的肩膀，把我拉得更近了些。我又开始哭了。

vocab.ex: The weather is starting to get bad.
During the sale, people were buying things left and right.
He put his arm around his friend to comfort her.

gram.name: shouldn't have + 过去分词
gram.function: 表示“本不应该做某事但实际上做了”（此处指“本不该让某事发生但却发生了”），用于对过去的行为或不作为表示后悔或批评。'We shouldn't have let her get this bad' 表达了维娅的自责和后悔。

example.en: I feel sick. I shouldn't have eaten that whole pizza.
example.cn: 我感觉不舒服。我本不该吃掉一整个披萨的。

variants: should have + pp (本该做但没做)
gram.constraints: 用于虚拟语气，谈论与过去事实相反的情况。

paras.en: "I'm sorry, Auggie," she said softly. "I'm really sorry about everything, okay? You forgive me? You know how much I love you, right?" I nodded. Somehow that fight didn't matter much now. "Was Mommy bleeding?" I asked. "It was just a nip," said Via. "Right there." She pointed to the bottom of her thumb to show me exactly where Daisy had bitten Mom. "Did it hurt her?" "Mommy's okay, Auggie. She's fine."
paras.cn: “对不起，奥吉，” 她轻声说。“我真的为所有事感到抱歉，好吗？你原谅我吗？你知道我有多爱你，对吧？” 我点了点头。不知何故，那场争吵现在不那么重要了。“妈咪流血了吗？” 我问。“只是轻轻咬了一下，” 维娅说。“就在这里。” 她指着她大拇指的根部，给我看黛西咬妈妈的确切位置。“她疼吗？” “妈咪没事，奥吉。她很好。”

vocab.ex: She closed the door softly so as not to wake the baby.
It's important to learn to forgive others.
We got lost, but somehow we found our way back home.
He cut his finger and it started to bleed.
The puppy gave my finger a playful nip.
He hit his thumb with the hammer by accident.

gram.name: 视角转变
gram.pattern: A significant event changes a character's priorities.
gram.function: 句子 'Somehow that fight didn't matter much now' 标记了一个重要的情感转折点。一个更大的悲剧（黛西的危机）使得之前看似重要的冲突（与维娅的争吵）变得微不足道。这显示了在重大事件面前，人的价值观和关注点会如何重新排序。

example.en: After the accident, their petty arguments didn't seem to matter anymore.
example.cn: 事故发生后，他们那些琐碎的争吵似乎不再重要了。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的叙事技巧，用于展现角色的成长或情境的变化。

paras.en: Mom and Dad came home two hours later. We knew the second they opened the door and Daisy wasn't with them that Daisy was gone. We all sat down in the living room around the pile of Daisy's toys. Dad told us what happened at the animal hospital, how the vet took Daisy for some Xrays and blood tests, then came back and told them she had a huge mass in her stomach. She was having trouble breathing. Mom and Dad didn't want her to suffer, so Daddy picked her up in his arms like he always liked to do, with her legs straight up in the air, and he and Mom kissed her goodbye over and over again and whispered to her while the vet put a needle into her leg. And then after about a minute she died in Daddy's arms. It was so peaceful, Daddy said. She wasn't in any pain at all. Like she was just going to sleep. A couple of times while he talked, Dad's voice got trembly and he cleared his throat.
paras.cn: 两小时后，爸爸妈妈回到了家。在他们打开门而黛西没有和他们在一起的那一刻，我们就知道黛西已经走了。我们都坐在客厅里，围着那堆黛西的玩具。爸爸告诉我们动物医院里发生的事，兽医如何带黛西去拍X光和做血检，然后回来告诉他们她肚子里有个巨大的肿块。她呼吸困难。爸爸妈妈不想让她受苦，所以爸爸像他一直喜欢做的那样把她抱在怀里，她的腿直直地伸在空中，他和妈妈一遍又一遍地亲吻她告别，在兽医把针头扎进她腿里的时候对她低语。然后大约一分钟后，她在爸爸的怀里死去了。爸爸说，过程非常安详。她一点痛苦也没有。就像她只是睡着了一样。他说话的时候，有几次爸爸的声音变得颤抖，他还清了清嗓子。

vocab.ex: The doctor ordered an X-ray of his broken arm.
The tests revealed a large mass in her lung.
He didn't want to see his old dog suffer anymore.
He practiced the song over and over again until it was perfect.
After a long illness, he had a peaceful death.
Her voice was trembly as she gave the emotional speech.
He cleared his throat before he began to speak.

gram.name: 死亡的委婉语
gram.pattern: Using softer language to describe death.
gram.function: 通过使用“安详”（peaceful）和比喻“就像她只是睡着了一样”（Like she was just going to sleep），爸爸试图用更温和、更少创伤性的语言来描述黛西的死亡，以安慰孩子们。这是在谈论死亡等困难话题时常见的沟通策略。

example.en: Instead of saying he died, they said he 'passed away.'
example.cn: 他们没有说他死了，而是说他“过世了”。

gram.constraints: 是一种旨在减轻情感冲击的语言技巧。

paras.en: I've never seen Dad cry before, but I saw him cry tonight. I had gone into Mom and Dad's bedroom looking for Mom to put me to bed, but saw Dad sitting on the edge of the bed, taking off his socks. His back was to the door, so he didn't know I was there. At first I thought he was laughing because his shoulders were shaking, but then he put his palms on his eyes and I realized he was crying. It was the quietest crying I've ever heard. Like a whisper. I was going to go over to him, but then I thought maybe he was whisper-crying because he didn't want me or anyone else to hear him. So I walked out and went to Via's room, and I saw Mom lying next to Via on the bed, and Mom was whispering to Via, who was crying. So I went to my bed and put on my pajamas without anyone telling me to and put the night-light on and turned the light off and crawled into the little mountain of stuffed animals I had left on my bed earlier. It felt like that all had happened a million years ago. I took my hearing aids off and put them on the night table and pulled the covers up to my ears and imagined Daisy snuggling with me, her big wet tongue licking my face all over like it was her favorite face in the world. And that's how I fell asleep.
paras.cn: 我以前从未见过爸爸哭，但今晚我看到他哭了。我走进爸爸妈妈的卧室找妈妈给我盖被子，但看到爸爸坐在床边脱袜子。他背对着门，所以他不知道我在那里。起初我以为他在笑，因为他的肩膀在抖动，但接着他用手掌捂住了眼睛，我意识到他在哭。那是我听过的最安静的哭声。像一声耳语。我本打算走过去，但后来我想也许他是在无声地哭泣，因为他不想让我或任何其他人听到。于是我走了出去，去了维娅的房间，我看到妈妈躺在维娅旁边的床上，妈妈正在对哭泣的维娅低语。所以我回到我的床上，没等任何人告诉我，就穿上了睡衣，打开小夜灯，关掉大灯，然后爬进了我早些时候留在床上的那座毛绒玩具小山里。感觉所有那些事都像发生在一万亿年前一样。我摘下助听器，把它们放在床头柜上，把被子拉到耳朵上，想象着黛西依偎着我，她那湿漉漉的大舌头舔遍我的脸，好像那是她在世界上最喜欢的脸。我就是那样睡着的。

vocab.ex: His hands were shaking from the cold.
He held the small bird gently in the palms of his hands.
The author coined the term 'whisper-crying' to describe a very quiet form of sobbing.
The child was afraid of the dark, so he slept with a night-light on.
He was so tired he just wanted to crawl into bed.

gram.name: 平行悲伤场景
gram.pattern: Observing separate but emotionally similar scenes.
gram.function: 叙述者接连看到了两个独立的、私密的悲伤场景：爸爸独自“无声地哭泣”，以及妈妈在安慰哭泣的维娅。通过将这两个平行的场景并置，作者展现了家庭成员各自处理悲伤的方式，突显了尽管大家都在一起，悲伤在某种程度上仍是一种孤独的体验，最终导致主角也选择独自面对。

example.en: In one room, a child was laughing. In the next room, an old man was weeping.
example.cn: 在一个房间里，一个孩子在笑。在隔壁房间，一个老人在哭泣。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比或并列来深化主题的叙事技巧。

paras.en: I woke up later on and it was still dark. I got out of bed and walked into Mom and Dad's bedroom. "Mommy?" I whispered. It was completely dark, so I couldn't see her open her eyes. "Mommy?" "You okay, honey?" she said groggily. "Can I sleep with you?" Mom scooted over toward Daddy's side of the bed, and I snuggled up next to her. She kissed my hair.
paras.cn: 我后来醒了，天还黑着。我下了床，走进爸爸妈妈的卧室。“妈咪？” 我低声说。房间里一片漆黑，所以我看不见她睁开眼睛。“妈咪？” “你还好吗，宝贝？” 她睡意朦胧地说。“我能和你一起睡吗？” 妈妈朝爸爸那边挪了挪，我紧挨着她依偎下来。她亲了亲我的头发。

vocab.ex: He leaned in to whisper a secret in her ear.

vocab.mean: 昏昏沉沉地；睡意朦胧地
vocab.ex: "What time is it?" she asked groggily, just waking up.
Could you scoot over a bit so I can sit down?
The children snuggled up under the warm blanket.

gram.name: 用一般过去时营造即时感
gram.pattern: A series of simple past tense verbs.
gram.function: 通过一连串简短、连续的一般过去时动作（'woke up', 'got out', 'walked', 'scooted over', 'snuggled up', 'kissed'），作者创造了一种清晰、流畅的叙事流，让读者能够身临其境地感受这个夜晚安静而亲密的时刻。

example.en: He opened the door, walked inside, and turned on the light.
example.cn: 他打开门，走了进去，然后打开了灯。

gram.constraints: 是叙事中最基本、最有效的时态用法。

paras.en: "Is your hand okay?" I said. "Via told me Daisy bit you." "It was only a nip," she whispered in my ear. "Mommy . . ." I started crying. "I'm sorry about what I said." "Shhh . . . There's nothing to be sorry about," she said, so quietly I could barely hear her. She was rubbing the side of her face against my face.
paras.cn: “你的手还好吗？” 我说。“维娅告诉我黛西咬了你。” “只是轻轻咬了一下，” 她在我耳边低语。“妈咪……” 我开始哭了。“我为我刚才说的话感到抱歉。” “嘘……没什么好抱歉的，” 她说，声音轻得我几乎听不见。她用她的脸颊蹭着我的脸。

vocab.ex: The puppy gave my finger a playful nip.
"Shhh, the baby is sleeping," she whispered.
The room was so dark I could barely see anything.
The friendly cat started to rub against my leg.

gram.name: so... that... 结果状语从句
gram.function: 用于强调程度之深以至于产生了某种结果。'...so quietly I could barely hear her' 强调了妈妈声音的轻柔程度及其结果。

example.en: He spoke so softly that I had to ask him to repeat himself.
example.cn: 他说话声音太小了，我不得不让他重复一遍。

gram.constraints: 连词 'that' 在这种结构中常常被省略，尤其是在口语中。

paras.en: "Is Via ashamed of me?" I said. "No, honey, no. You know she's not. She's just adjusting to a new school. It's not easy." "I know." "I know you know." "I'm sorry I called you a liar." "Go to sleep, sweet boy. . . . I love you so much." "I love you so much, too, Mommy." "Good night, honey," she said very softly.
paras.cn: “维娅是为我感到羞耻吗？” 我说。“不，宝贝，不。你知道她不是。她只是在适应一所新学校。这不容易。” “我知道。” “我知道你知道。” “对不起，我叫你骗子。” “睡吧，好孩子……我非常爱你。” “我也非常爱你，妈咪。” “晚安，宝贝，” 她非常轻柔地说。

vocab.ex: He was ashamed of his behavior at the party.
It took him a while to adjust to living in a new country.
He's a known liar, so don't believe anything he says.
She closed the door softly so as not to wake the baby.

gram.name: 对话中的结句重复 (Epistrophe)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a word or phrase at the end of successive clauses.
gram.function: 对话 '"I know." "I know you know."' 中，'know' 的重复（一种结句重复）创造了一种深刻的共鸣和理解。它超越了简单的信息交换，表达了母子之间无需多言的默契和同理心。

example.en: "I'm tired." "I know you're tired."
example.cn: “我累了。”“我知道你累了。”

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中表现深层情感联系的有效修辞手法。

paras.en: "Mommy, is Daisy with Grans now?" "I think so." "Are they in heaven?" "Yes." "Do people look the same when they get to heaven?" "I don't know. I don't think so." "Then how do people recognize each other?"
paras.cn: “妈咪，黛西现在和外婆在一起吗？” “我想是的。” “她们在天堂吗？” “是的。” “人们到了天堂还长得和原来一样吗？” “我不知道。我想不是。” “那人们怎么认出彼此呢？”

vocab.ex: We're going to visit Grans this weekend.
Many religions have a concept of heaven as an afterlife.
I didn't recognize him at first with his new haircut.

gram.name: 对抽象概念的 childlike 探究
gram.pattern: A series of simple, logical questions about a complex topic.
gram.function: 主角通过一系列简单、具体且逻辑连贯的问题（“黛西和外婆在一起吗？” -> “她们在天堂吗？” -> “人们在天堂长得一样吗？” -> “那怎么认出彼此？”），展现了儿童试图理解死亡和来世等抽象概念的思维过程。这种探究方式既天真又深刻。

example.en: A child might ask, "If the sky is blue, why isn't the water in my glass blue?"
example.cn: 一个孩子可能会问：“如果天空是蓝色的，为什么我杯子里的水不是蓝色的？”

gram.constraints: 是表现儿童视角和好奇心的有效叙事技巧。

paras.en: "I don't know, sweetie." She sounded tired. "They just feel it. You don't need your eyes to love, right? You just feel it inside you. That's how it is in heaven. It's just love, and no one forgets who they love." She kissed me again. "Now go to sleep, honey. It's late. And I'm so tired."
paras.cn: “我不知道，宝贝。” 她听起来很累。“他们只是感觉到。爱是不需要眼睛的，对吧？你只是在内心感觉到它。天堂就是那样的。那里只有爱，而且没有人会忘记他们所爱的人。” 她又亲了我一下。“现在睡吧，宝贝。很晚了。而且我太累了。”

vocab.ex: Come here, sweetie, and give me a hug.
After a long day of work, he felt very tired.
Don't forget to lock the door when you leave.

gram.name: 抽象解释
gram.pattern: Using abstract nouns and simple sentences to explain a complex idea.
gram.function: 为了回答一个孩子关于身份认同的深刻问题，妈妈没有提供具体的、物理性的答案，而是转向了更抽象、更普世的概念——爱。通过'They just feel it.', 'It's just love'等简洁而有力的句子，她将天堂定义为一个超越外貌、以纯粹情感联系为基础的地方，这既是对孩子的安慰，也是本书的核心主题之一。

example.en: What is courage? It's not the absence of fear; it's acting in spite of it.
example.cn: 什么是勇气？它不是没有恐惧，而是在恐惧中依然行动。

gram.constraints: 是一种将复杂哲学概念简化的沟通方式。

paras.en: But I couldn't go to sleep, even after I knew she had fallen asleep. I could hear Daddy sleeping, too, and I imagined I could hear Via sleeping down the hallway in her room. And I wondered if Daisy was sleeping in heaven right then. And if she was sleeping, was she dreaming about me? And I wondered how it would feel to be in heaven someday and not have my face matter anymore. Just like it never, ever mattered to Daisy.
paras.cn: 但我睡不着，即使我知道她已经睡着了。我也能听到爸爸在睡觉，我想象着我能听到维娅在走廊尽头的房间里睡觉。我想知道黛西此刻是否正在天堂里睡觉。如果她在睡觉，她是在梦见我吗？我想知道有一天在天堂里，我的脸不再重要，那会是什么感觉。就像它对黛西来说，从来、从来都不重要一样。

vocab.ex: He was so tired that he fell asleep in the middle of the movie.
I wonder what time the movie starts tonight.
It doesn't matter what other people think; just be yourself.
I will never, ever forget your kindness.

gram.name: 首语重复法与意识流
gram.pattern: Repetition of 'And I wondered...' to show a train of thought.
gram.function: 通过重复 'And I wondered...'，作者模仿了意识流的写作手法，展现了主角在安静的夜晚里，思绪从一个问题自然地流向下一个更深层次的问题。这种结构不仅连接了关于黛西的思念和关于自我接纳的渴望，还揭示了他内心最深处的愿望——在一个地方，外貌不再是评判标准。

example.en: And I thought about yesterday. And I thought about tomorrow. And I thought about all the things that could have been.
example.cn: 然后我想到了昨天。然后我想到了明天。然后我想到了所有本可能发生的事情。

gram.constraints: 是一种描绘内心思考过程的有效文学技巧。

paras.en: Via brought home three tickets to her school play a few days after Daisy died. We never mentioned the fight we had over dinner again. On the night of the play, right before she and Justin were leaving to get to their school early, she gave me a big hug and told me she loved me and she was proud to be my sister.
paras.cn: 黛西死后几天，维娅带回了三张她学校戏剧的票。我们再也没提过我们在晚餐时的那场争吵。在戏剧演出的那晚，就在她和贾斯汀要早点去学校之前，她给了我一个大大的拥抱，告诉我她爱我，并为是我的姐姐感到骄傲。

vocab.ex: Did you buy the tickets for the concert yet?
Please don't mention the surprise party to him.
He was proud to be a member of the winning team.

gram.name: 未言明的和解
gram.pattern: A statement of non-action followed by an act of affection.
gram.function: 通过“我们再也没提过那场争吵”（不作为）与维娅充满爱意的告别（作为）的并置，作者暗示了在黛西去世这一更大的悲伤面前，姐弟俩已经默默地和解了。这种“不言自明”的和解比直接的道歉更有感染力。

example.en: They never spoke of the argument again, but from that day on, their friendship was stronger.
example.cn: 他们再也没提过那次争吵，但从那天起，他们的友谊变得更加牢固。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过行为而非言语来展示人物关系变化的技巧。

paras.en: This was my first time in Via's new school. It was much bigger than her old school, and a thousand times bigger than my school. More hallways. More room for people. The only really bad thing about my bionic Lobot hearing aids was the fact that I couldn't wear a baseball cap anymore. In situations like these, baseball caps come in really handy. Sometimes I wish I could still get away with wearing that old astronaut helmet I used to wear when I was little. Believe it or not, people would think seeing a kid in an astronaut helmet was a lot less weird than seeing my face. Anyway, I kept my head down as I walked right behind Mom through the long bright hallways.
paras.cn: 这是我第一次来维娅的新学校。它比她的旧学校大得多，比我的学校大一千倍。更多的走廊。更多的空间容纳人。我那仿生的洛博特助听器唯一真正糟糕的地方在于，我再也不能戴棒球帽了。在这种情况下，棒球帽真的非常方便。有时候我希望我还能像小时候那样戴着那个旧的宇航员头盔蒙混过关。信不信由你，人们会觉得看到一个戴着宇航员头盔的孩子，远没有看到我的脸那么奇怪。总之，我一直低着头，紧跟在妈妈身后穿过又长又亮的走廊。

vocab.ex: This new phone is a thousand times better than my old one.
Don't throw that box away; it might come in handy later.

vocab.mean: （做坏事而）未被发现或惩罚；蒙混过关
vocab.ex: He thought he could get away with cheating on the test, but the teacher caught him.
Believe it or not, I've never seen that movie.

gram.name: wish + could (表示对现在能力的愿望)
gram.function: 用于表达对现在或将来能力的愿望，而这种能力是不具备或不可能实现的。'I wish I could still get away with...' 表达了主角希望自己现在还能像过去一样用头盔隐藏自己的愿望。

example.en: I wish I could fly like a bird.
example.cn: 我希望能像鸟儿一样飞翔。

gram.constraints: 用于虚拟语气，表达与现实相反的愿望。

paras.en: We followed the crowd to the auditorium, where students handed out programs at the front entrance. We found seats in the fifth row, close to the middle. As soon as we sat down, Mom started looking inside her pocketbook. "I can't believe I forgot my glasses!" she said. Dad shook his head. Mom was always forgetting her glasses, or her keys, or something or other. She is flaky that way. "You want to move closer?" said Dad. Mom squinted at the stage. "No, I can see okay." "Speak now or forever hold your peace," said Dad. "I'm fine," answered Mom.
paras.cn: 我们跟着人群来到礼堂，有学生在正门口分发节目单。我们在第五排靠近中间的位置找到了座位。我们一坐下，妈妈就开始在她的手提包里翻找。“我真不敢相信我忘了我的眼镜！” 她说。爸爸摇了摇头。妈妈总是忘记她的眼镜，或者钥匙，或者别的什么东西。她在这方面就是这么不靠谱。“你想坐近点吗？” 爸爸说。妈妈眯着眼看着舞台。“不，我看得清。” “现在就说，否则就永远别作声，” 爸爸说。“我很好，” 妈妈回答。

vocab.ex: The teacher will hand out the worksheets at the beginning of class.
I read the program to see who the actors were.
He's always busy with his projects or something or other.
He's a bit flaky, so don't be surprised if he's late.
He had to squint to read the small print on the sign.

vocab.word: speak now or forever hold your peace
vocab.ph: /spiːk naʊ ɔːr fərˈevər hoʊld jɔːr piːs/
vocab.mean: 现在就说，否则就永远别作声（源自婚礼誓词）
vocab.ex: This is your last chance to object. Speak now or forever hold your peace.

gram.name: 现在进行时 + always (表习惯)
gram.function: 用于描述一个反复发生的、令人恼火或觉得好笑的习惯。'Mom was always forgetting her glasses' 强调了妈妈健忘这个习惯的频繁性和令人无奈的特点。

example.en: He is always losing his keys!
example.cn: 他老是丢钥匙！

gram.constraints: 常带有一种情感色彩，如抱怨或幽默。
