paras.en: "Look, there's Justin," I said to Dad, pointing out Justin's picture in the program. "That's a nice picture of him," he answered, nodding. "How come there's no picture of Via?" I said. "She's an understudy," said Mom. "But, look: here's her name." "Why do they call her an understudy?" I asked. "Wow, look at Miranda's picture," said Mom to Dad. "I don't think I would have recognized her." "Why do they call it understudy?" I repeated.
paras.cn: “看，那是贾斯汀，” 我对爸爸说，指着节目单上贾斯汀的照片。“他的照片很帅，” 他点着头回答。“为什么没有维娅的照片？” 我说。“她是替补演员，” 妈妈说。“但是，你看：这里有她的名字。” “他们为什么叫她替补演员？” 我问。“哇，看看米兰达的照片，” 妈妈对爸爸说。“我想我都认不出她了。” “他们为什么叫它替补演员？” 我重复道。

vocab.ex: He was quick to point out my mistakes.
How come you're not going to the party?
The understudy had to perform when the lead actor got sick.
I didn't recognize him at first with his new haircut.

gram.name: 通过转换话题进行回避
gram.pattern: Ignoring a question and introducing a new topic.
gram.function: 当主角问及“understudy”的含义时，妈妈没有回答，而是立即将话题转向了米兰达的照片。这种明显的转换话题行为，暗示了妈妈可能在回避与维娅角色相关的更深层次的问题，或者只是单纯地分心了。这在对话中是一种常见的回避策略。

example.en: A: "Did you finish your project?" B: "Wow, look at that bird outside!"
example.cn: A：“你完成你的项目了吗？” B：“哇，看外面那只鸟！”

gram.constraints: 是一种通过转移注意力来回避问题的技巧。

paras.en: "It's what they call someone who replaces an actor if he can't perform for some reason," answered Mom. "Did you hear Martin's getting remarried?" Dad said to Mom. "Are you kidding me?!" Mom answered, like she was surprised. "Who's Martin?" I asked. "Miranda's father," Mom answered, and then to Dad: "Who told you?" "I ran into Miranda's mother in the subway. She's not happy about it. He has a new baby on the way and everything." "Wow," said Mom, shaking her head. "What are you guys talking about?" I said. "Nothing," answered Dad. "But why do they call it understudy?" I said.
paras.cn: “那是他们对因故不能表演时替换演员的人的称呼，” 妈妈回答。“你听说马丁要再婚了吗？” 爸爸对妈妈说。“你不是在开玩笑吧？！” 妈妈回答，好像很惊讶似的。“马丁是谁？” 我问。“米兰达的父亲，” 妈妈回答，然后对爸爸说：“谁告诉你的？” “我在地铁上碰到了米兰达的妈妈。她对此很不高兴。他快要有新孩子了之类的。” “哇，” 妈妈摇着头说。“你们在聊什么？” 我说。“没什么，” 爸爸回答。“但他们为什么叫它替补演员？” 我说。

vocab.ex: We need to replace the old batteries in the remote control.
After his wife passed away, he never remarried.
I ran into an old friend at the supermarket yesterday.
They are very excited because they have a baby on the way.

gram.name: 分层对话与排斥
gram.pattern: Two parallel conversations happening, one excluding a participant.
gram.function: 作者巧妙地将两组对话交织在一起：一组是父母之间关于成人八卦的对话，另一组是主角坚持不懈地追问“understudy”的含义。这种分层的对话结构，通过父母对孩子问题的忽略和最终用“没什么”来打发，生动地展现了孩子在成人世界中被排斥在外的感受。

example.en: "Where are we going?" the child asked, while the parents whispered, "We can't tell her the real reason yet."
example.cn: “我们要去哪里？” 孩子问道，而父母则低声说：“我们还不能告诉她真正的原因。”

gram.constraints: 是一种展示不同角色关注点和关系动态的高级技巧。

paras.en: "I don't know, Auggie Doggie," Dad answered. "Maybe because the actors kind of study under the main actors or something? I really don't know." I was going to say something else but then the lights went down. The audience got very quiet very quickly. "Daddy, can you please not call me Auggie Doggie anymore?" I whispered in Dad's ear. Dad smiled and nodded and gave me a thumbs-up.
paras.cn: “我不知道，奥吉狗狗，” 爸爸回答。“也许是因为替补演员有点像在主要演员手下学习之类的？我真的不知道。” 我正要说点别的，但这时灯光暗了下来。观众很快就变得非常安静。“爸爸，你能不能以后别再叫我奥吉狗狗了？” 我在爸爸耳边低声说。爸爸笑了笑，点了点头，给了我一个大拇指。

vocab.ex: His father's nickname for him was 'Auggie Doggie,' from an old cartoon.
The lights went down just as the movie was about to start.
I don't live there anymore.
She gave me a thumbs-up to show that everything was okay.

gram.name: 请求改变行为
gram.function: 用于礼貌地请求某人停止一个持续性的行为。'Can you please not call me Auggie Doggie anymore?' 是主角成长的一个标志，他开始希望被更成熟地对待，并用一种直接但礼貌的方式表达了出来。

example.en: Can you please not leave your wet towel on the bed anymore?
example.cn: 你以后能不能别再把湿毛巾留在床上了？

gram.constraints: 是一种在亲密关系中表达需求的常见方式。

paras.en: The play started. The curtain opened. The stage was completely empty except for Justin, who was sitting on an old rickety chair tuning his fiddle. He was wearing an oldfashioned type of suit and a straw hat. "This play is called 'Our Town,' " he said to the audience. "It was written by Thornton Wilder; produced and directed by Philip Davenport. . . . The name of the town is Grover's Corners, New Hampshire—just across the Massachusetts line: latitude 42 degrees 40 minutes; longitude 70 degrees 37 minutes. The First Act shows a day in our town. The day is May 7, 1901. The time is just before dawn."
paras.cn: 戏剧开始了。幕布拉开。舞台上完全是空的，只有贾斯汀，他坐在一把摇摇晃晃的旧椅子上，正在给他的小提琴调音。他穿着一套老式西装，戴着一顶草帽。“这部戏叫做《我们的小镇》，” 他对观众说。“它由桑顿·怀尔德编剧；菲利普·达文波特制作和导演……小镇的名字是新罕布什尔州的格罗弗角——就在马萨诸塞州线的另一边：纬度42度40分；经度70度37分。第一幕展示了我们小镇的一天。日期是1901年5月7日。时间是黎明前。”

vocab.ex: The audience applauded as the curtain rose.
Be careful sitting on that rickety old chair.
The guitarist was tuning his instrument before the concert.
The ship sailed south to a lower latitude.
The coordinates include both latitude and longitude.
They woke up before dawn to watch the sunrise.

gram.name: 元戏剧（打破第四堵墙）
gram.pattern: A character directly addressing the audience.
gram.function: 剧中角色（贾斯汀）直接对观众说话，介绍戏剧的背景信息，而不是与其他角色互动。这种技巧，即“打破第四堵墙”，模糊了戏剧与现实的界限，创造了一种独特的、更具参与感的观剧体验。

example.en: In the middle of the scene, the actor turned and said, "You're probably wondering what happens next."
example.cn: 在场景进行到一半时，演员转过身来说：“你们可能想知道接下来会发生什么。”

gram.constraints: 是一种在现代戏剧中常见的艺术手法。

paras.en: I knew right then and there that I was going to like the play. It wasn't like other school plays I've been to, like The Wizard of Oz or Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs. No, this was grown-up seeming, and I felt smart sitting there watching it.
paras.cn: 我当时当场就知道我会喜欢这部戏。它不像我以前去过的其他学校戏剧，比如《绿野仙踪》或《天降美食》。不，这部戏看起来很成熟，我坐在那里看的时候感觉自己很聪明。

vocab.ex: He made the decision right then and there, without any hesitation.
She preferred reading grown-up seeming novels to children's books.
That was a smart move to solve the problem.

gram.name: 否定-肯定对比结构
gram.pattern: It wasn't like X. No, this was Y.
gram.function: 通过首先否定它与自己熟悉的事物（'other school plays'）的相似性，然后用 'No' 引出一个强烈的转折，并肯定它是一种全新的、不同的事物（'grown-up seeming'），作者突出了这部戏剧给主角带来的独特和成熟的印象。

example.en: It wasn't like any other concert I had seen. No, this was a true performance art piece.
example.cn: 它不像我见过的任何其他音乐会。不，这是一件真正的表演艺术作品。

gram.constraints: 是一种清晰地强调差异和独特性的对比结构。

paras.en: A little later in the play, a character named Mrs. Webb calls out for her daughter, Emily. I knew from the program that that was the part Miranda was playing, so I leaned forward to get a better look at her. "That's Miranda," Mom whispered to me, squinting at the stage when Emily walked out. "She looks so different. . . ." "It's not Miranda," I whispered. "It's Via." "Oh my God!" said Mom, lurching forward in her seat. "Shh!" said Dad. "It's Via," Mom whispered to him. "I know," whispered Dad, smiling. "Shhh!"
paras.cn: 戏剧进行了一会儿后，一个叫韦布夫人的角色喊她的女儿艾米丽。我从节目单上知道那是米兰达扮演的角色，所以我向前探身想更清楚地看看她。“那是米兰达，” 妈妈对我低声说，在艾米丽走出来时眯着眼看着舞台。“她看起来好不一样……” “不是米兰达，” 我低声说。“是维娅。” “哦我的天！” 妈妈说，在座位上猛地向前倾。“嘘！” 爸爸说。“是维娅，” 妈妈对他低声说。“我知道，” 爸爸微笑着低声说。“嘘！”

vocab.ex: He had to lean forward to hear what she was saying.
He had to squint to read the small print on the sign.
The bus suddenly stopped, and the passengers lurched forward.

gram.name: 用简短对话营造高潮
gram.pattern: A series of short, revelatory lines of dialogue.
gram.function: 通过一连串简短、快速的对话（'It's not Miranda.' 'It's Via.' 'Oh my God!' 'I know.'），作者逐步揭示了戏剧舞台上的意外情况，并展现了不同角色的反应（主角的发现，妈妈的震惊，爸爸的了然）。这种快节奏的对话有效地将故事推向了一个情感高潮。

example.en: "It's gone." "What's gone?" "The diamond!" "No!"
example.cn: “它不见了。”“什么不见了？”“钻石！”“不！”

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中创造悬念和高潮的有效技巧。

paras.en: The play was so amazing. I don't want to give away the ending, but it's the kind of ending that makes people in the audience teary. Mom totally lost it when Via-as-Emily said: "Good-by, Good-by world! Good-by, Grover's Corners . . . Mama and Papa. Good-by to clocks ticking and Mama's sunflowers. And food and coffee. And new-ironed dresses and hot baths . . . and sleeping and waking up. Oh, earth, you're too wonderful for anybody to realize you!"
paras.cn: 那场戏太棒了。我不想剧透结局，但那是那种能让观众潸然泪下的结局。当扮演艾米丽的维娅说出那段台词时，妈妈完全绷不住了：“再见，再见世界！再见，格罗弗角……爸爸妈妈。再见了，滴答作响的时钟和妈妈的向日葵。还有食物和咖啡。还有新熨的裙子和热水澡……还有睡觉和醒来。哦，地球，你太美好了，以至于没人能真正认识你！”

vocab.ex: Please don't give away the ending of the movie; I haven't seen it yet.
It was a very teary goodbye at the airport.
When she heard the sad news, she completely lost it.
The only sound in the quiet room was the ticking of the clock.
He wore a crisp, freshly ironed shirt to the interview.

gram.name: 连接词省略
gram.pattern: A list of nouns or phrases without conjunctions.
gram.function: 在告别一系列日常事物时（'...clocks ticking and Mama's sunflowers. And food and coffee. And new-ironed dresses...'），通过省略某些并列连词，创造了一种急促、情感充沛的节奏，模仿了角色在告别时思绪万千、试图抓住每一个珍贵记忆的感觉。

example.en: I need to buy milk, eggs, bread, cheese for the recipe.
example.cn: 我需要为食谱买牛奶、鸡蛋、面包、奶酪。

gram.constraints: 是一种用于创造特定节奏和情绪的修辞技巧。

paras.en: Via was actually crying while she was saying this. Like real tears: I could see them rolling down her cheeks. It was totally awesome. After the curtain closed, everyone in the audience started clapping. Then the actors came out one by one. Via and Justin were the last ones out, and when they appeared, the whole audience rose to their feet. "Bravo!" I heard Dad yelling through his hands. "Why is everyone getting up?" I said. "It's a standing ovation," said Mom, getting up. So I got up and clapped and clapped. I clapped until my hands hurt. For a second, I imagined how cool it would be to be Via and Justin right then, having all these people standing up and cheering for them. I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.
paras.cn: 维娅说这话的时候真的在哭。是真眼泪：我能看到它们顺着她的脸颊滚落。那真是太棒了。幕布落下后，所有观众都开始鼓掌。然后演员们一个接一个地走出来。维娅和贾斯汀是最后出来的，当他们出现时，全体观众都起立了。“好极了！” 我听到爸爸用手拢着嘴喊道。“为什么大家都站起来了？” 我说。“这是起立鼓掌，” 妈妈说着站了起来。于是我也站起来，不停地鼓掌。我一直拍到手疼。有一瞬间，我想象着如果我是当时的维娅和贾斯汀，有这么多人站起来为他们欢呼，那该有多酷。我认为应该有一条规则，世界上每个人一生中至少应该得到一次起立鼓掌。

vocab.ex: A single tear rolled down his cheek.
We had an awesome time at the concert.
The crowd rose to their feet to applaud the performance.
"Bravo!" the audience shouted after the incredible solo.
The orchestra received a well-deserved standing ovation.

gram.name: should (用于表达理想)
gram.pattern: There should be a rule that...
gram.function: 用于表达一种理想化的、道德上的“应该”，描述说话者认为世界应有的样子。'there should be a rule that everyone... should get a standing ovation' 表达了主角的一个充满同理心和善意的、理想化的愿望。

example.en: There should be more kindness in the world.
example.cn: 世界上应该有更多的善良。

gram.constraints: 用于提出建议、表达责任或理想状态。

paras.en: Finally, after I don't know how many minutes, the line of actors onstage stepped back and the curtain closed in front of them. The clapping stopped and the lights went up and the audience started getting up to leave. Me and Mom and Dad made our way to the backstage. Crowds of people were congratulating the performers, surrounding them, patting them on the back. We saw Via and Justin at the center of the crowd, smiling at everyone, laughing and talking.
paras.cn: 最后，不知过了多少分钟，舞台上的一排演员向后退去，幕布在他们面前合上了。掌声停止，灯光亮起，观众开始起身离开。我和爸爸妈妈设法走到了后台。成群的人正在祝贺表演者们，围着他们，拍着他们的背。我们看到维娅和贾斯汀在人群中心，对每个人微笑，又笑又谈。

vocab.ex: There were only two actors onstage for the final scene.
We had to make our way to the front through the dense crowd.
After the show, we went backstage to meet the band.
I want to congratulate you on your graduation.

vocab.mean: 拍某人的背（表示鼓励或祝贺）
vocab.ex: The coach patted the player on the back for a great game.

gram.name: 过去进行时（用于描述背景场景）
gram.function: 用于描述在过去某个时间点正在发生的背景情景。'Crowds of people were congratulating..., surrounding..., patting...' 描绘了后台当时热闹、持续进行的活动场面。

example.en: When I walked in, music was playing and people were dancing.
example.cn: 我走进去时，音乐正响着，人们正跳着舞。

gram.constraints: 强调过程的持续性。

paras.en: "Via!" shouted Dad, waving as he made his way through the crowd. When he got close enough, he hugged her and lifted her off the floor a little. "You were amazing, sweetheart!" "Oh my God, Via!" Mom was screaming with excitement. "Oh my God, oh my God!" She was hugging Via so hard I thought Via would suffocate, but Via was laughing. "You were brilliant!" said Dad. "Brilliant!" Mom said, kind of nodding and shaking her head at the same time.
paras.cn: “维娅！” 爸爸喊道，一边挥手一边穿过人群。当他走得足够近时，他拥抱了她，把她稍微抱离了地面。“你太棒了，宝贝！” “哦我的天，维娅！” 妈妈兴奋地尖叫。“哦我的天，哦我的天！” 她抱维娅抱得那么紧，我都以为维娅会窒息，但维娅在笑。“你太出色了！” 爸爸说。“太出色了！” 妈妈说，同时有点又点头又摇头。

vocab.ex: It was difficult to make our way through the dense jungle.
He was so strong he could lift his little brother off the floor with one arm.
The hug was so tight I felt like I was going to suffocate.
She gave a brilliant performance in the school play.

gram.name: 重复（用于表达兴奋）
gram.pattern: Repetition of a word or phrase
gram.function: 通过重复感叹语 'Oh my God, oh my God!' 和形容词 'Brilliant!'，作者生动地传达了父母见到女儿出色表演后那种无法用正常语言表达的、压倒性的兴奋和骄傲。

example.en: "Wow, wow, wow!" he exclaimed when he saw his new car.
example.cn: “哇，哇，哇！” 他看到他的新车时惊叹道。

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中表现强烈情感的常见方式。

paras.en: "And you, Justin," said Dad, shaking Justin's hand and giving him a hug at the same time. "You were fantastic!" "Fantastic!" Mom repeated. She was, honestly, so emotional she could barely talk. "What a shock to see you up there, Via!" said Dad. "Mom didn't even recognize you at first!" I said. "I didn't recognize you!" said Mom, her hand over her mouth.
paras.cn: “还有你，贾斯汀，” 爸爸说，一边和贾斯汀握手，一边给了他一个拥抱。“你太棒了！” “太棒了！” 妈妈重复道。说实话，她情绪激动得几乎说不出话来。“在台上看到你真是个惊喜，维娅！” 爸爸说。“妈妈一开始都没认出你！” 我说。“我都没认出你！” 妈妈说，用手捂着嘴。

vocab.ex: We had a fantastic vacation in Hawaii.
It was a very emotional moment when he said goodbye.
The room was so dark I could barely see anything.
It was a complete shock to find out he had resigned.

gram.name: 感叹句 (What a...!)
gram.function: 用于对名词所代表的人或事物表示强烈的惊讶或其他情感。'What a shock to see you up there!' 强烈地表达了看到维娅上台表演时的惊讶之情。

example.en: What a surprise to see you here!
example.cn: 在这里见到你真是个惊喜！

gram.constraints: 用于修饰名词。

paras.en: "Miranda got sick right before the show started," said Via, all of out of breath. "There wasn't even time to make an announcement." I have to say she looked kind of strange, because she was wearing all this makeup and I'd never seen her like this before. "And you just stepped in there right at the last minute?" said Dad. "Wow." "She was amazing, wasn't she?" said Justin, his arm around Via. "There wasn't a dry eye in the house," said Dad.
paras.cn: “米兰达在演出开始前就病了，” 维娅说，气喘吁吁的。“甚至没有时间发布通知。” 我得说她看起来有点奇怪，因为她化了浓妆，我以前从没见过她这个样子。“所以你是在最后一刻才顶替上去的？” 爸爸说。“哇。” “她很棒，不是吗？” 贾斯汀说，胳膊搂着维娅。“全场没有一双眼睛是干的，” 爸爸说。

vocab.ex: After running for the bus, I was completely out of breath.
The principal made an important announcement over the loudspeaker.
She doesn't wear a lot of makeup, just some mascara and lipstick.
When the lead actor got sick, his understudy had to step in.
He cancelled the trip at the last minute.

vocab.word: not a dry eye in the house
vocab.ph: /nɒt ə draɪ aɪ ɪn ðə haʊs/
vocab.ex: When the soldier was reunited with his dog, there wasn't a dry eye in the house.

gram.name: 附加疑问句（否定）
gram.function: 附加在陈述句后，用于寻求对方的同意或确认。'She was amazing, wasn't she?' 是贾斯汀在寻求大家对他观点的认同，并引以为豪。

example.en: The weather is beautiful today, isn't it?
example.cn: 今天天气真好，不是吗？

gram.constraints: 遵循“前肯后否”的原则。

paras.en: "Is Miranda okay?" I said, but no one heard me. At that moment, a man who I think was their teacher came over to Justin and Via, clapping his hands. "Bravo, bravo! Olivia and Justin!" He kissed Via on both cheeks. "I flubbed a couple of lines," said Via, shaking her head. "But you got through it," said the man, smiling ear to ear.
paras.cn: “米兰达还好吗？” 我说，但没人听到我。就在那一刻，一个我认为是他们老师的男人向贾斯汀和维娅走来，拍着手。“太棒了，太棒了！奥利维亚和贾斯汀！” 他在维娅的双颊上亲了一下。“我搞砸了几句台词，” 维娅摇着头说。“但你挺过来了，” 那个男人说，笑得合不拢嘴。

vocab.ex: A waiter came over to take our order.
"Bravo!" the audience shouted after the incredible solo.
The actor flubbed his lines during the most important scene.
The exam was difficult, but I managed to get through it.
He was grinning from ear to ear after winning the prize.

gram.name: 插入语从句 (I think)
gram.function: 在定语从句或其他结构中插入 'I think'、'I believe' 等短语，用于表示不确定性或表达个人看法，使语气更柔和或更具主观性。'a man who I think was their teacher' 表明叙述者并不完全确定那个人的身份。

example.en: This is a solution which, I believe, will work for everyone.
example.cn: 这是一个我相信会对所有人都有效的解决方案。

gram.constraints: 通常用逗号与句子的其余部分隔开。

paras.en: "Mr. Davenport, these are my parents," said Via. "You must be so proud of your girl!" he said, shaking their hands with both his hands. "We are!" "And this is my little brother, August," said Via. He looked like he was about to say something but suddenly froze when he looked at me.
paras.cn: “达文波特先生，这是我的父母，” 维娅说。“你们一定为你们的女儿感到非常骄傲！” 他说，用双手握着他们的手。“我们是的！” “这是我的小弟弟，奥古斯特，” 维娅说。他看起来正要说什么，但看到我时突然僵住了。

vocab.ex: She was very proud of her daughter for winning the award.
Hurry up, the movie is about to start!

vocab.mean: 僵住；（因恐惧、惊讶而）呆住
vocab.ex: He froze when he saw the snake on the path in front of him.

gram.name: 情态动词推测 (must be)
gram.function: 用于对现在的情况进行非常肯定的推测或推断。'You must be so proud...' 表达了老师根据维娅的出色表现，对她父母的心情做出的强烈而肯定的推断。

example.en: You've been working all day. You must be tired.
example.cn: 你工作了一整天。你一定很累了。

gram.constraints: 只用于对现在情况的推测。

paras.en: "Mr. D," said Justin, pulling him by the arm, "come meet my mom." Via was about to say something to me, but then someone else came over and started talking to her, and before I knew it, I was kind of alone in the crowd. I mean, I knew where Mom and Dad were, but there were so many people all around us, and people kept bumping into me, spinning me around a bit, giving me that one-two look, which made me feel kind of bad. I don't know if it was because I was feeling hot or something, but I kind of started getting dizzy. People's faces were blurring in my head. And their voices were so loud it was almost hurting my ears. I tried to turn the volume down on my Lobot ears, but I got confused and turned them louder at first, which kind of shocked me. And then I looked up and I didn't see Mom or Dad or Via anywhere.
paras.cn: “D先生，” 贾斯汀拉着他的胳膊说，“来见见我妈妈。” 维娅正要对我说些什么，但这时另一个人走过来开始和她说话，在我意识到之前，我就有点独自一人在人群中了。我的意思是，我知道爸爸妈妈在哪里，但我们周围有太多人，人们不停地撞到我，让我有点晕头转向，给我那种先看一眼再看一眼的眼神，这让我感觉有点糟糕。我不知道是不是因为我感觉热还是怎么了，但我开始有点头晕。人们的脸在我脑海里变得模糊。他们的声音那么大，几乎要伤到我的耳朵了。我试着调低我洛博特耳朵的音量，但我搞混了，一开始反而调得更大声，这让我吓了一跳。然后我抬起头，哪里也看不到妈妈、爸爸或维娅。

vocab.ex: I was just going to rest for five minutes, and before I knew it, an hour had passed.

vocab.mean: 先看一眼再看一眼的眼神（指惊讶或好奇的反复打量）
vocab.ex: Whenever he wears his unusual hat, he gets that one-two look from strangers.
Standing up too quickly can make you feel dizzy.
Without my glasses, everything just blurs together.

gram.name: 感官超载描述
gram.pattern: A series of descriptions detailing overwhelming sensory input.
gram.function: 作者通过一连串的感官描述（被撞、被看、头晕、脸变模糊、声音太大），层层递进地营造了一种感官超载的体验，生动地传达了主角在拥挤、混乱的环境中所感受到的焦虑、迷失和恐慌。

example.en: The lights were flashing, the music was pounding, and the crowd was screaming. It was a complete sensory overload.
example.cn: 灯光在闪烁，音乐在轰鸣，人群在尖叫。那是一场彻底的感官超载。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过具体细节来构建抽象情感的写作技巧。

paras.en: "Via?" I yelled out. I started pushing through the crowd to find Mom. "Mommy!" I really couldn't see anything but people's stomachs and ties all around me. "Mommy!" Suddenly someone picked me up from behind. "Look who's here!" said a familiar voice, hugging me tight. I thought it was Via at first, but when I turned around, I was completely surprised. "Hey, Major Tom!" she said. "Miranda!" I answered, and I gave her the tightest hug I could give.
paras.cn: “维娅？” 我喊了出来。我开始推开人群找妈妈。“妈咪！” 我真的什么也看不见，除了周围人们的肚子和领带。“妈咪！” 突然有人从后面把我抱了起来。“看这是谁！” 一个熟悉的声音说，紧紧地抱着我。我起初以为是维娅，但当我转过身时，我完全惊呆了。“嘿，汤姆少校！” 她说。“米兰达！” 我回答，然后我给了她我能给的最紧的拥抱。

vocab.ex: He yelled out her name across the crowded room.
He had to push through the crowd to get to the front of the stage.
Her face looked familiar, but I couldn't remember her name.

vocab.mean: 汤姆少校（大卫·鲍伊歌曲中的虚构宇航员，此处为昵称）
vocab.ex: The song 'Space Oddity' is about an astronaut named Major Tom.

gram.name: 高潮与解决
gram.pattern: Rising tension followed by a sudden, surprising resolution.
gram.function: 在前面段落中，作者通过感官超载和主角的呼喊，将焦虑和迷失的情绪推向高潮。然后，通过一个出人意料的角色（米兰达）的突然出现和她亲切的举动，这种紧张感被瞬间化解。这种“紧张-解决”的结构为章节提供了一个充满情感和惊喜的有力结尾。

example.en: He was lost in the dark forest, completely alone. Suddenly, a light appeared in the distance.
example.cn: 他在黑暗的森林里迷路了，孤身一人。突然，远处出现了一盏灯。

gram.constraints: 是叙事中创造戏剧性效果的基本结构。
